73 #ifdef MSWIN
74  static int
75 fd_read(sock_T fd, char *buf, size_t len)
76 {
77  HANDLE h = (HANDLE)fd;
78  DWORD nread;
79 
80  if (!ReadFile(h, buf, (DWORD)len, &nread, NULL))
81  return -1;
82  return (int)nread;
83 }
84 
85  static int
86 fd_write(sock_T fd, char *buf, size_t len)
87 {
88  size_t todo = len;
89  HANDLE h = (HANDLE)fd;
90  DWORD nwrite, size, done = 0;
91  OVERLAPPED ov;
92 
93  while (todo > 0)
94  {
95  if (todo > MAX_NAMED_PIPE_SIZE)
96  size = MAX_NAMED_PIPE_SIZE;
97  else
98  size = (DWORD)todo;
99  // If the pipe overflows while the job does not read the data,
100  // WriteFile() will block forever. This abandons the write.
101  memset(&ov, 0, sizeof(ov));
102  nwrite = 0;
103  if (!WriteFile(h, buf + done, size, &nwrite, &ov))
104  {
105  DWORD err = GetLastError();
106 
107  if (err != ERROR_IO_PENDING)
108  return -1;
109  if (!GetOverlappedResult(h, &ov, &nwrite, FALSE))
110  return -1;
111  FlushFileBuffers(h);
112  }
113  else if (nwrite == 0)
114  // WriteFile() returns TRUE but did not write anything. This causes
115  // a hang, so bail out.
116  break;
117  todo -= nwrite;
118  done += nwrite;
119  }
120  return (int)done;
121 }

128  CloseHandle(h);
129 }

132 /* Log file opened with ch_logfile(). */

138  void
139 ch_logfile(char_u *fname, char_u *opt)
140 {
141  FILE *file = NULL;
142 
143  if (log_fd != NULL)
144  {
145  if (*fname != NUL)
146  ch_log(NULL, "closing, opening %s", fname);
147  else
148  ch_log(NULL, "closing");
149  fclose(log_fd);
150  }
151 
152  if (*fname != NUL)
153  {
154  file = fopen((char *)fname, *opt == 'w' ? "w" : "a");
155  if (file == NULL)
156  {
157  semsg(_(e_notopen), fname);
158  return;
159  }
160  }
161  log_fd = file;
162 
163  if (log_fd != NULL)
164  {
165  fprintf(log_fd, "==== start log session ====\n");
166 #ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
167  profile_start(&log_start);
168 #endif
169  }
170 }
171 
172  int
173 ch_log_active(void)
174 {
175  return log_fd != NULL;
176 }

178  static void
179 ch_log_lead(const char *what, channel_T *ch, ch_part_T part)
180 {
181  if (log_fd != NULL)
182  {
183 #ifdef FEAT_RELTIME
184  proftime_T log_now;
185 
186  profile_start(&log_now);
187  profile_sub(&log_now, &log_start);
188  fprintf(log_fd, "%s ", profile_msg(&log_now));
189 #endif
190  if (ch != NULL)
191  {
192  if (part < PART_COUNT)
193  fprintf(log_fd, "%son %d(%s): ",
194  what, ch->ch_id, part_names[part]);
195  else
196  fprintf(log_fd, "%son %d: ", what, ch->ch_id);
197  }
198  else
199  fprintf(log_fd, "%s: ", what);
200  }
201 }

204  void
205 ch_log(channel_T *ch, const char *fmt, ...)
206 {
207  if (log_fd != NULL)
208  {
209  va_list ap;
210 
211  ch_log_lead("", ch, PART_COUNT);
212  va_start(ap, fmt);
213  vfprintf(log_fd, fmt, ap);
214  va_end(ap);
215  fputc('\n', log_fd);
216  fflush(log_fd);
217  did_repeated_msg = 0;
218  }
219 }
220 #endif

250  static char *
251 strerror_win32(int eno)
252 {
253  static LPVOID msgbuf = NULL;
254  char_u *ptr;
255 
256  if (msgbuf)
257  {
258  LocalFree(msgbuf);
259  msgbuf = NULL;
260  }
261  FormatMessage(
262  FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER |
263  FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM |
264  FORMAT_MESSAGE_IGNORE_INSERTS,
265  NULL,
266  eno,
267  MAKELANGID(LANG_ENGLISH, SUBLANG_DEFAULT),
268  (LPTSTR) &msgbuf,
269  0,
270  NULL);
271  if (msgbuf != NULL)
272  /* chomp \r or \n */
273  for (ptr = (char_u *)msgbuf; *ptr; ptr++)
274  switch (*ptr)
275  {
276  case '\r':
277  STRMOVE(ptr, ptr + 1);
278  ptr--;
279  break;
280  case '\n':
281  if (*(ptr + 1) == '\0')
282  *ptr = '\0';
283  else
284  *ptr = ' ';
285  break;
286  }
287  return msgbuf;
288 }
289 #endif

291 /*
292  * The list of all allocated channels.
293  */
294 static channel_T *first_channel = NULL;
295 static int next_ch_id = 0;
296 
297 /*
298  * Allocate a new channel. The refcount is set to 1.
299  * The channel isn't actually used until it is opened.
300  * Returns NULL if out of memory.
301  */
302  channel_T *
303 add_channel(void)
304 {
305  ch_part_T part;
306  channel_T *channel = ALLOC_CLEAR_ONE(channel_T);
307 
308  if (channel == NULL)
309  return NULL;
310 
311  channel->ch_id = next_ch_id++;
312  ch_log(channel, "Created channel");
313 
314  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_COUNT; ++part)
315  {
316  channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd = INVALID_FD;
317 #ifdef FEAT_GUI_X11
318  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = (XtInputId)NULL;
319 #endif
320 #ifdef FEAT_GUI_GTK
321  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = 0;
322 #endif
323  channel->ch_part[part].ch_timeout = 2000;
324  }
325 
326  if (first_channel != NULL)
327  {
328  first_channel->ch_prev = channel;
329  channel->ch_next = first_channel;
330  }
331  first_channel = channel;
332 
333  channel->ch_refcount = 1;
334  return channel;
335 }
336 
337  int
338 has_any_channel(void)
339 {
340  return first_channel != NULL;
341 }
342 
343 /*
344  * Called when the refcount of a channel is zero.
345  * Return TRUE if "channel" has a callback and the associated job wasn't
346  * killed.
347  */
348  static int
349 channel_still_useful(channel_T *channel)
350 {
351  int has_sock_msg;
352  int has_out_msg;
353  int has_err_msg;
354 
355  /* If the job was killed the channel is not expected to work anymore. */
356  if (channel->ch_job_killed && channel->ch_job == NULL)
357  return FALSE;
358 
359  /* If there is a close callback it may still need to be invoked. */
360  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name != NULL)
361  return TRUE;
362 
363  /* If reading from or a buffer it's still useful. */
364  if (channel->ch_part[PART_IN].ch_bufref.br_buf != NULL)
365  return TRUE;
366 
367  /* If there is no callback then nobody can get readahead. If the fd is
368  * closed and there is no readahead then the callback won't be called. */
369  has_sock_msg = channel->ch_part[PART_SOCK].ch_fd != INVALID_FD
370  || channel->ch_part[PART_SOCK].ch_head.rq_next != NULL
371  || channel->ch_part[PART_SOCK].ch_json_head.jq_next != NULL;
372  has_out_msg = channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_fd != INVALID_FD
373  || channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_head.rq_next != NULL
374  || channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_json_head.jq_next != NULL;
375  has_err_msg = channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_fd != INVALID_FD
376  || channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_head.rq_next != NULL
377  || channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_json_head.jq_next != NULL;
378  return (channel->ch_callback.cb_name != NULL && (has_sock_msg
379  || has_out_msg || has_err_msg))
380  || ((channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_callback.cb_name != NULL
381  || channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_bufref.br_buf != NULL)
382  && has_out_msg)
383  || ((channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_callback.cb_name != NULL
384  || channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_bufref.br_buf != NULL)
385  && has_err_msg);
386 }

397 /*
398  * Close a channel and free all its resources.
399  */
400  static void
401 channel_free_contents(channel_T *channel)
402 {
403  channel_close(channel, TRUE);
404  channel_clear(channel);
405  ch_log(channel, "Freeing channel");
406 }

408  static void
409 channel_free_channel(channel_T *channel)
410 {
411  if (channel->ch_next != NULL)
412  channel->ch_next->ch_prev = channel->ch_prev;
413  if (channel->ch_prev == NULL)
414  first_channel = channel->ch_next;
415  else
416  channel->ch_prev->ch_next = channel->ch_next;
417  vim_free(channel);
418 }
419 
420  static void
421 channel_free(channel_T *channel)
422 {
423  if (!in_free_unref_items)
424  {
425  if (safe_to_invoke_callback == 0)
426  channel->ch_to_be_freed = TRUE;
427  else
428  {
429  channel_free_contents(channel);
430  channel_free_channel(channel);
431  }
432  }
433 }
434 
435 /*
436  * Close a channel and free all its resources if there is no further action
437  * possible, there is no callback to be invoked or the associated job was
438  * killed.
439  * Return TRUE if the channel was freed.
440  */
441  static int
442 channel_may_free(channel_T *channel)
443 {
444  if (!channel_still_useful(channel))
445  {
446  channel_free(channel);
447  return TRUE;
448  }
449  return FALSE;
450 }
451 
452 /*
453  * Decrement the reference count on "channel" and maybe free it when it goes
454  * down to zero. Don't free it if there is a pending action.
455  * Returns TRUE when the channel is no longer referenced.
456  */
457  int
458 channel_unref(channel_T *channel)
459 {
460  if (channel != NULL && --channel->ch_refcount <= 0)
461  return channel_may_free(channel);
462  return FALSE;
463 }
464 
465  int
466 free_unused_channels_contents(int copyID, int mask)
467 {
468  int did_free = FALSE;
469  channel_T *ch;
470 
471  /* This is invoked from the garbage collector, which only runs at a safe
472  * point. */
473  ++safe_to_invoke_callback;
474 
475  for (ch = first_channel; ch != NULL; ch = ch->ch_next)
476  if (!channel_still_useful(ch)
477  && (ch->ch_copyID & mask) != (copyID & mask))
478  {
479  /* Free the channel and ordinary items it contains, but don't
480  * recurse into Lists, Dictionaries etc. */
481  channel_free_contents(ch);
482  did_free = TRUE;
483  }
484 
485  --safe_to_invoke_callback;
486  return did_free;
487 }
488 
489  void
490 free_unused_channels(int copyID, int mask)
491 {
492  channel_T *ch;
493  channel_T *ch_next;
494 
495  for (ch = first_channel; ch != NULL; ch = ch_next)
496  {
497  ch_next = ch->ch_next;
498  if (!channel_still_useful(ch)
499  && (ch->ch_copyID & mask) != (copyID & mask))
500  {
501  /* Free the channel struct itself. */
502  channel_free_channel(ch);
503  }
504  }
505 }

509 # if defined(FEAT_GUI_X11) || defined(FEAT_GUI_GTK)
510 /*
511  * Lookup the channel from the socket. Set "partp" to the fd index.
512  * Returns NULL when the socket isn't found.
513  */
514  static channel_T *
515 channel_fd2channel(sock_T fd, ch_part_T *partp)
516 {
517  channel_T *channel;
518  ch_part_T part;
519 
520  if (fd != INVALID_FD)
521  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL;
522  channel = channel->ch_next)
523  {
524  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
525  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd == fd)
526  {
527  *partp = part;
528  return channel;
529  }
530  }
531  return NULL;
532 }
533 
534  static void
535 channel_read_fd(int fd)
536 {
537  channel_T *channel;
538  ch_part_T part;
539 
540  channel = channel_fd2channel(fd, &part);
541  if (channel == NULL)
542  ch_error(NULL, "Channel for fd %d not found", fd);
543  else
544  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_read_fd");
545 }
546 # endif

583  static void
584 channel_gui_register_one(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part UNUSED)
585 {
586  if (!CH_HAS_GUI)
587  return;
588 
589  /* gets stuck in handling events for a not connected channel */
590  if (channel->ch_keep_open)
591  return;
592 
593 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_X11
594  /* Tell notifier we are interested in being called when there is input on
595  * the editor connection socket. */
596  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler == (XtInputId)NULL)
597  {
598  ch_log(channel, "Registering part %s with fd %d",
599  part_names[part], channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd);
600 
601  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = XtAppAddInput(
602  (XtAppContext)app_context,
603  channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd,
604  (XtPointer)(XtInputReadMask + XtInputExceptMask),
605  messageFromServerX11,
606  (XtPointer)(long)channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd);
607  }
608 # else
609 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_GTK
610  /* Tell gdk we are interested in being called when there is input on the
611  * editor connection socket. */
612  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler == 0)
613  {
614  ch_log(channel, "Registering part %s with fd %d",
615  part_names[part], channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd);
616 # if GTK_CHECK_VERSION(3,0,0)
617  GIOChannel *chnnl = g_io_channel_unix_new(
618  (gint)channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd);
619 
620  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = g_io_add_watch(
621  chnnl,
622  G_IO_IN|G_IO_HUP|G_IO_ERR|G_IO_PRI,
623  messageFromServerGtk3,
624  GINT_TO_POINTER(channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd));
625 
626  g_io_channel_unref(chnnl);
627 # else
628  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = gdk_input_add(
629  (gint)channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd,
630  (GdkInputCondition)
631  ((int)GDK_INPUT_READ + (int)GDK_INPUT_EXCEPTION),
632  messageFromServerGtk2,
633  (gpointer)(long)channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd);
634 # endif
635  }
636 # endif
637 # endif
638 }

640  static void
641 channel_gui_register(channel_T *channel)
642 {
643  if (channel->CH_SOCK_FD != INVALID_FD)
644  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_SOCK);
645  if (channel->CH_OUT_FD != INVALID_FD
646  && channel->CH_OUT_FD != channel->CH_SOCK_FD)
647  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_OUT);
648  if (channel->CH_ERR_FD != INVALID_FD
649  && channel->CH_ERR_FD != channel->CH_SOCK_FD
650  && channel->CH_ERR_FD != channel->CH_OUT_FD)
651  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_ERR);
652 }

654 /*

658  void
659 channel_gui_register_all(void)

662

664  channel_gui_register(channel);
665 }

667  static void
668 channel_gui_unregister_one(channel_T *channel UNUSED, ch_part_T part UNUSED)
669 {
670 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_X11
671  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler != (XtInputId)NULL)
672  {
673  ch_log(channel, "Unregistering part %s", part_names[part]);
674  XtRemoveInput(channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler);
675  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = (XtInputId)NULL;
676  }
677 # else
678 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_GTK
679  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler != 0)
680  {
681  ch_log(channel, "Unregistering part %s", part_names[part]);
682 # if GTK_CHECK_VERSION(3,0,0)
683  g_source_remove(channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler);
684 # else
685  gdk_input_remove(channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler);
686 # endif
687  channel->ch_part[part].ch_inputHandler = 0;
688  }
689 # endif
690 # endif
691 }

697

699  channel_gui_unregister_one(channel, part);

704 static char *e_cannot_connect = N_("E902: Cannot connect to port");
705 
706 /*
707  * Open a socket channel to "hostname":"port".
708  * "waittime" is the time in msec to wait for the connection.
709  * When negative wait forever.
710  * Returns the channel for success.
711  * Returns NULL for failure.
712  */
713  channel_T *
714 channel_open(
715  char *hostname,
716  int port_in,
717  int waittime,
718  void (*nb_close_cb)(void))
719 {
720  int sd = -1;
721  struct sockaddr_in server;
722  struct hostent *host;
723 #ifdef MSWIN
724  u_short port = port_in;
725  u_long val = 1;
726 #else
727  int port = port_in;
728 #endif
729  channel_T *channel;
730  int ret;
731 
732 #ifdef MSWIN
733  channel_init_winsock();
734 #endif
735 
736  channel = add_channel();
737  if (channel == NULL)
738  {
739  ch_error(NULL, "Cannot allocate channel.");
740  return NULL;
741  }
742 
743  /* Get the server internet address and put into addr structure */
744  /* fill in the socket address structure and connect to server */
745  vim_memset((char *)&server, 0, sizeof(server));
746  server.sin_family = AF_INET;
747  server.sin_port = htons(port);
748  if ((host = gethostbyname(hostname)) == NULL)
749  {
750  ch_error(channel, "in gethostbyname() in channel_open()");
751  PERROR(_("E901: gethostbyname() in channel_open()"));
752  channel_free(channel);
753  return NULL;
754  }
755  {
756  char *p;
757 
758  /* When using host->h_addr_list[0] directly ubsan warns for it to not
759  * be aligned. First copy the pointer to avoid that. */
760  memcpy(&p, &host->h_addr_list[0], sizeof(p));
761  memcpy((char *)&server.sin_addr, p, host->h_length);
762  }
763 
764  /* On Mac and Solaris a zero timeout almost never works. At least wait
765  * one millisecond. Let's do it for all systems, because we don't know why
766  * this is needed. */
767  if (waittime == 0)
768  waittime = 1;
769 
770  /*
771  * For Unix we need to call connect() again after connect() failed.
772  * On Win32 one time is sufficient.
773  */
774  while (TRUE)
775  {
776  long elapsed_msec = 0;
777  int waitnow;
778 
779  if (sd >= 0)
780  sock_close(sd);
781  sd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
782  if (sd == -1)
783  {
784  ch_error(channel, "in socket() in channel_open().");
785  PERROR(_("E898: socket() in channel_open()"));
786  channel_free(channel);
787  return NULL;
788  }
789 
790  if (waittime >= 0)
791  {
792  /* Make connect() non-blocking. */
793  if (
794 #ifdef MSWIN
795  ioctlsocket(sd, FIONBIO, &val) < 0
796 #else
797  fcntl(sd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK) < 0
798 #endif
799  )
800  {
801  SOCK_ERRNO;
802  ch_error(channel,
803  "channel_open: Connect failed with errno %d", errno);
804  sock_close(sd);
805  channel_free(channel);
806  return NULL;
807  }
808  }
809 
810  /* Try connecting to the server. */
811  ch_log(channel, "Connecting to %s port %d", hostname, port);
812  ret = connect(sd, (struct sockaddr *)&server, sizeof(server));
813 
814  if (ret == 0)
815  /* The connection could be established. */
816  break;
817 
818  SOCK_ERRNO;
819  if (waittime < 0 || (errno != EWOULDBLOCK
820  && errno != ECONNREFUSED
821 #ifdef EINPROGRESS
822  && errno != EINPROGRESS
823 #endif
824  ))
825  {
826  ch_error(channel,
827  "channel_open: Connect failed with errno %d", errno);
828  PERROR(_(e_cannot_connect));
829  sock_close(sd);
830  channel_free(channel);
831  return NULL;
832  }
833 
834  /* Limit the waittime to 50 msec. If it doesn't work within this
835  * time we close the socket and try creating it again. */
836  waitnow = waittime > 50 ? 50 : waittime;
837 
838  /* If connect() didn't finish then try using select() to wait for the
839  * connection to be made. For Win32 always use select() to wait. */
840 #ifndef MSWIN
841  if (errno != ECONNREFUSED)
842 #endif
843  {
844  struct timeval tv;
845  fd_set rfds;
846  fd_set wfds;
847 #ifndef MSWIN
848  int so_error = 0;
849  socklen_t so_error_len = sizeof(so_error);
850  struct timeval start_tv;
851  struct timeval end_tv;
852 #endif
853  FD_ZERO(&rfds);
854  FD_SET(sd, &rfds);
855  FD_ZERO(&wfds);
856  FD_SET(sd, &wfds);
857 
858  tv.tv_sec = waitnow / 1000;
859  tv.tv_usec = (waitnow % 1000) * 1000;
860 #ifndef MSWIN
861  gettimeofday(&start_tv, NULL);
862 #endif
863  ch_log(channel,
864  "Waiting for connection (waiting %d msec)...", waitnow);
865  ret = select((int)sd + 1, &rfds, &wfds, NULL, &tv);
866 
867  if (ret < 0)
868  {
869  SOCK_ERRNO;
870  ch_error(channel,
871  "channel_open: Connect failed with errno %d", errno);
872  PERROR(_(e_cannot_connect));
873  sock_close(sd);
874  channel_free(channel);
875  return NULL;
876  }
877 
878 #ifdef MSWIN
879  /* On Win32: select() is expected to work and wait for up to
880  * "waitnow" msec for the socket to be open. */
881  if (FD_ISSET(sd, &wfds))
882  break;
883  elapsed_msec = waitnow;
884  if (waittime > 1 && elapsed_msec < waittime)
885  {
886  waittime -= elapsed_msec;
887  continue;
888  }
889 #else
890  /* On Linux-like systems: See socket(7) for the behavior
891  * After putting the socket in non-blocking mode, connect() will
892  * return EINPROGRESS, select() will not wait (as if writing is
893  * possible), need to use getsockopt() to check if the socket is
894  * actually able to connect.
895  * We detect a failure to connect when either read and write fds
896  * are set. Use getsockopt() to find out what kind of failure. */
897  if (FD_ISSET(sd, &rfds) || FD_ISSET(sd, &wfds))
898  {
899  ret = getsockopt(sd,
900  SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR, &so_error, &so_error_len);
901  if (ret < 0 || (so_error != 0
902  && so_error != EWOULDBLOCK
903  && so_error != ECONNREFUSED
904 # ifdef EINPROGRESS
905  && so_error != EINPROGRESS
906 # endif
907  ))
908  {
909  ch_error(channel,
910  "channel_open: Connect failed with errno %d",
911  so_error);
912  PERROR(_(e_cannot_connect));
913  sock_close(sd);
914  channel_free(channel);
915  return NULL;
916  }
917  }
918 
919  if (FD_ISSET(sd, &wfds) && so_error == 0)
920  /* Did not detect an error, connection is established. */
921  break;
922 
923  gettimeofday(&end_tv, NULL);
924  elapsed_msec = (end_tv.tv_sec - start_tv.tv_sec) * 1000
925  + (end_tv.tv_usec - start_tv.tv_usec) / 1000;
926 #endif
927  }
928 
929 #ifndef MSWIN
930  if (waittime > 1 && elapsed_msec < waittime)
931  {
932  /* The port isn't ready but we also didn't get an error.
933  * This happens when the server didn't open the socket
934  * yet. Select() may return early, wait until the remaining
935  * "waitnow" and try again. */
936  waitnow -= elapsed_msec;
937  waittime -= elapsed_msec;
938  if (waitnow > 0)
939  {
940  mch_delay((long)waitnow, TRUE);
941  ui_breakcheck();
942  waittime -= waitnow;
943  }
944  if (!got_int)
945  {
946  if (waittime <= 0)
947  /* give it one more try */
948  waittime = 1;
949  continue;
950  }
951  /* we were interrupted, behave as if timed out */
952  }
953 #endif
954 
955  /* We timed out. */
956  ch_error(channel, "Connection timed out");
957  sock_close(sd);
958  channel_free(channel);
959  return NULL;
960  }
961 
962  ch_log(channel, "Connection made");
963 
964  if (waittime >= 0)
965  {
966 #ifdef MSWIN
967  val = 0;
968  ioctlsocket(sd, FIONBIO, &val);
969 #else
970  (void)fcntl(sd, F_SETFL, 0);
971 #endif
972  }
973 
974  channel->CH_SOCK_FD = (sock_T)sd;
975  channel->ch_nb_close_cb = nb_close_cb;
976  channel->ch_hostname = (char *)vim_strsave((char_u *)hostname);
977  channel->ch_port = port_in;
978  channel->ch_to_be_closed |= (1U << PART_SOCK);
979 
980 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
981  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_SOCK);
982 #endif
983 
984  return channel;
985 }
986 
987 /*
988  * Copy callback from "src" to "dest", incrementing the refcounts.
989  */
990  static void
991 copy_callback(callback_T *dest, callback_T *src)
992 {
993  dest->cb_partial = src->cb_partial;
994  if (dest->cb_partial != NULL)
995  {
996  dest->cb_name = src->cb_name;
997  dest->cb_free_name = FALSE;
998  ++dest->cb_partial->pt_refcount;
999  }
1000  else
1001  {
1002  dest->cb_name = vim_strsave(src->cb_name);
1003  dest->cb_free_name = TRUE;
1004  func_ref(src->cb_name);
1005  }
1006 }
1007 
1008  static void
1009 free_set_callback(callback_T *cbp, callback_T *callback)
1010 {
1011  free_callback(cbp);
1012 
1013  if (callback->cb_name != NULL && *callback->cb_name != NUL)
1014  copy_callback(cbp, callback);
1015  else
1016  cbp->cb_name = NULL;
1017 }
1018 
1019 /*
1020  * Prepare buffer "buf" for writing channel output to.
1021  */
1022  static void
1023 prepare_buffer(buf_T *buf)
1024 {
1025  buf_T *save_curbuf = curbuf;
1026 
1027  buf_copy_options(buf, BCO_ENTER);
1028  curbuf = buf;
1029 #ifdef FEAT_QUICKFIX
1030  set_option_value((char_u *)"bt", 0L, (char_u *)"nofile", OPT_LOCAL);
1031  set_option_value((char_u *)"bh", 0L, (char_u *)"hide", OPT_LOCAL);
1032 #endif
1033  if (curbuf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
1034  ml_open(curbuf);
1035  curbuf = save_curbuf;
1036 }
1037 
1038 /*
1039  * Find a buffer matching "name" or create a new one.
1040  * Returns NULL if there is something very wrong (error already reported).
1041  */
1042  static buf_T *
1043 channel_find_buffer(char_u *name, int err, int msg)
1044 {
1045  buf_T *buf = NULL;
1046  buf_T *save_curbuf = curbuf;
1047 
1048  if (name != NULL && *name != NUL)
1049  {
1050  buf = buflist_findname(name);
1051  if (buf == NULL)
1052  buf = buflist_findname_exp(name);
1053  }
1054  if (buf == NULL)
1055  {
1056  buf = buflist_new(name == NULL || *name == NUL ? NULL : name,
1057  NULL, (linenr_T)0, BLN_LISTED | BLN_NEW);
1058  if (buf == NULL)
1059  return NULL;
1060  prepare_buffer(buf);
1061 
1062  curbuf = buf;
1063  if (msg)
1064  ml_replace(1, (char_u *)(err ? "Reading from channel error..."
1065  : "Reading from channel output..."), TRUE);
1066  changed_bytes(1, 0);
1067  curbuf = save_curbuf;
1068  }
1069 
1070  return buf;
1071 }
1072 
1073 /*
1074  * Set various properties from an "opt" argument.
1075  */
1076  static void
1077 channel_set_options(channel_T *channel, jobopt_T *opt)
1078 {
1079  ch_part_T part;
1080 
1081  if (opt->jo_set & JO_MODE)
1082  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_COUNT; ++part)
1083  channel->ch_part[part].ch_mode = opt->jo_mode;
1084  if (opt->jo_set & JO_IN_MODE)
1085  channel->ch_part[PART_IN].ch_mode = opt->jo_in_mode;
1086  if (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_MODE)
1087  channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_mode = opt->jo_out_mode;
1088  if (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_MODE)
1089  channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_mode = opt->jo_err_mode;
1090  channel->ch_nonblock = opt->jo_noblock;
1091 
1092  if (opt->jo_set & JO_TIMEOUT)
1093  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_COUNT; ++part)
1094  channel->ch_part[part].ch_timeout = opt->jo_timeout;
1095  if (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_TIMEOUT)
1096  channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_timeout = opt->jo_out_timeout;
1097  if (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_TIMEOUT)
1098  channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_timeout = opt->jo_err_timeout;
1099  if (opt->jo_set & JO_BLOCK_WRITE)
1100  channel->ch_part[PART_IN].ch_block_write = 1;
1101 
1102  if (opt->jo_set & JO_CALLBACK)
1103  free_set_callback(&channel->ch_callback, &opt->jo_callback);
1104  if (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_CALLBACK)
1105  free_set_callback(&channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_callback,
1106  &opt->jo_out_cb);
1107  if (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_CALLBACK)
1108  free_set_callback(&channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_callback,
1109  &opt->jo_err_cb);
1110  if (opt->jo_set & JO_CLOSE_CALLBACK)
1111  free_set_callback(&channel->ch_close_cb, &opt->jo_close_cb);
1112  channel->ch_drop_never = opt->jo_drop_never;
1113 
1114  if ((opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_IO) && opt->jo_io[PART_OUT] == JIO_BUFFER)
1115  {
1116  buf_T *buf;
1117 
1118  /* writing output to a buffer. Default mode is NL. */
1119  if (!(opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_MODE))
1120  channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_mode = MODE_NL;
1121  if (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_BUF)
1122  {
1123  buf = buflist_findnr(opt->jo_io_buf[PART_OUT]);
1124  if (buf == NULL)
1125  semsg(_(e_nobufnr), (long)opt->jo_io_buf[PART_OUT]);
1126  }
1127  else
1128  {
1129  int msg = TRUE;
1130 
1131  if (opt->jo_set2 & JO2_OUT_MSG)
1132  msg = opt->jo_message[PART_OUT];
1133  buf = channel_find_buffer(opt->jo_io_name[PART_OUT], FALSE, msg);
1134  }
1135  if (buf != NULL)
1136  {
1137  if (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_MODIFIABLE)
1138  channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_nomodifiable =
1139  !opt->jo_modifiable[PART_OUT];
1140 
1141  if (!buf->b_p_ma && !channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_nomodifiable)
1142  {
1143  emsg(_(e_modifiable));
1144  }
1145  else
1146  {
1147  ch_log(channel, "writing out to buffer '%s'",
1148  (char *)buf->b_ffname);
1149  set_bufref(&channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_bufref, buf);
1150  // if the buffer was deleted or unloaded resurrect it
1151  if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
1152  prepare_buffer(buf);
1153  }
1154  }
1155  }
1156 
1157  if ((opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_IO) && (opt->jo_io[PART_ERR] == JIO_BUFFER
1158  || (opt->jo_io[PART_ERR] == JIO_OUT && (opt->jo_set & JO_OUT_IO)
1159  && opt->jo_io[PART_OUT] == JIO_BUFFER)))
1160  {
1161  buf_T *buf;
1162 
1163  /* writing err to a buffer. Default mode is NL. */
1164  if (!(opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_MODE))
1165  channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_mode = MODE_NL;
1166  if (opt->jo_io[PART_ERR] == JIO_OUT)
1167  buf = channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_bufref.br_buf;
1168  else if (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_BUF)
1169  {
1170  buf = buflist_findnr(opt->jo_io_buf[PART_ERR]);
1171  if (buf == NULL)
1172  semsg(_(e_nobufnr), (long)opt->jo_io_buf[PART_ERR]);
1173  }
1174  else
1175  {
1176  int msg = TRUE;
1177 
1178  if (opt->jo_set2 & JO2_ERR_MSG)
1179  msg = opt->jo_message[PART_ERR];
1180  buf = channel_find_buffer(opt->jo_io_name[PART_ERR], TRUE, msg);
1181  }
1182  if (buf != NULL)
1183  {
1184  if (opt->jo_set & JO_ERR_MODIFIABLE)
1185  channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_nomodifiable =
1186  !opt->jo_modifiable[PART_ERR];
1187  if (!buf->b_p_ma && !channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_nomodifiable)
1188  {
1189  emsg(_(e_modifiable));
1190  }
1191  else
1192  {
1193  ch_log(channel, "writing err to buffer '%s'",
1194  (char *)buf->b_ffname);
1195  set_bufref(&channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_bufref, buf);
1196  // if the buffer was deleted or unloaded resurrect it
1197  if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
1198  prepare_buffer(buf);
1199  }
1200  }
1201  }
1202 
1203  channel->ch_part[PART_OUT].ch_io = opt->jo_io[PART_OUT];
1204  channel->ch_part[PART_ERR].ch_io = opt->jo_io[PART_ERR];
1205  channel->ch_part[PART_IN].ch_io = opt->jo_io[PART_IN];
1206 }
1207 
1208 /*
1209  * Implements ch_open().
1210  */
1211  static channel_T *
1212 channel_open_func(typval_T *argvars)
1213 {
1214  char_u *address;
1215  char_u *p;
1216  char *rest;
1217  int port;
1218  jobopt_T opt;
1219  channel_T *channel = NULL;
1220 
1221  address = tv_get_string(&argvars[0]);
1222  if (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN
1223  && (argvars[1].v_type != VAR_DICT || argvars[1].vval.v_dict == NULL))
1224  {
1225  emsg(_(e_invarg));
1226  return NULL;
1227  }
1228 
1229  /* parse address */
1230  p = vim_strchr(address, ':');
1231  if (p == NULL)
1232  {
1233  semsg(_(e_invarg2), address);
1234  return NULL;
1235  }
1236  *p++ = NUL;
1237  port = strtol((char *)p, &rest, 10);
1238  if (*address == NUL || port <= 0 || *rest != NUL)
1239  {
1240  p[-1] = ':';
1241  semsg(_(e_invarg2), address);
1242  return NULL;
1243  }
1244 
1245  /* parse options */
1246  clear_job_options(&opt);
1247  opt.jo_mode = MODE_JSON;
1248  opt.jo_timeout = 2000;
1249  if (get_job_options(&argvars[1], &opt,
1250  JO_MODE_ALL + JO_CB_ALL + JO_WAITTIME + JO_TIMEOUT_ALL, 0) == FAIL)
1251  goto theend;
1252  if (opt.jo_timeout < 0)
1253  {
1254  emsg(_(e_invarg));
1255  goto theend;
1256  }
1257 
1258  channel = channel_open((char *)address, port, opt.jo_waittime, NULL);
1259  if (channel != NULL)
1260  {
1261  opt.jo_set = JO_ALL;
1262  channel_set_options(channel, &opt);
1263  }
1264 theend:
1265  free_job_options(&opt);
1266  return channel;
1267 }
1268 
1269  static void
1270 ch_close_part(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
1271 {
1272  sock_T *fd = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
1273 
1274  if (*fd != INVALID_FD)
1275  {
1276  if (part == PART_SOCK)
1277  sock_close(*fd);
1278  else
1279  {
1280  /* When using a pty the same FD is set on multiple parts, only
1281  * close it when the last reference is closed. */
1282  if ((part == PART_IN || channel->CH_IN_FD != *fd)
1283  && (part == PART_OUT || channel->CH_OUT_FD != *fd)
1284  && (part == PART_ERR || channel->CH_ERR_FD != *fd))
1285  {
1286 #ifdef MSWIN
1287  if (channel->ch_named_pipe)
1288  DisconnectNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd);
1289 #endif
1290  fd_close(*fd);
1291  }
1292  }
1293  *fd = INVALID_FD;
1294 
1295  /* channel is closed, may want to end the job if it was the last */
1296  channel->ch_to_be_closed &= ~(1U << part);
1297  }
1298 }
1299 
1300  void
1301 channel_set_pipes(channel_T *channel, sock_T in, sock_T out, sock_T err)
1302 {
1303  if (in != INVALID_FD)
1304  {
1305  ch_close_part(channel, PART_IN);
1306  channel->CH_IN_FD = in;
1307 # if defined(UNIX)
1308  /* Do not end the job when all output channels are closed, wait until
1309  * the job ended. */
1310  if (mch_isatty(in))
1311  channel->ch_to_be_closed |= (1U << PART_IN);
1312 # endif
1313  }
1314  if (out != INVALID_FD)
1315  {
1316 # if defined(FEAT_GUI)
1317  channel_gui_unregister_one(channel, PART_OUT);
1318 # endif
1319  ch_close_part(channel, PART_OUT);
1320  channel->CH_OUT_FD = out;
1321  channel->ch_to_be_closed |= (1U << PART_OUT);
1322 # if defined(FEAT_GUI)
1323  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_OUT);
1324 # endif
1325  }
1326  if (err != INVALID_FD)
1327  {
1328 # if defined(FEAT_GUI)
1329  channel_gui_unregister_one(channel, PART_ERR);
1330 # endif
1331  ch_close_part(channel, PART_ERR);
1332  channel->CH_ERR_FD = err;
1333  channel->ch_to_be_closed |= (1U << PART_ERR);
1334 # if defined(FEAT_GUI)
1335  channel_gui_register_one(channel, PART_ERR);
1336 # endif
1337  }
1338 }
1339 
1340 /*
1341  * Sets the job the channel is associated with and associated options.
1342  * This does not keep a refcount, when the job is freed ch_job is cleared.
1343  */
1344  void
1345 channel_set_job(channel_T *channel, job_T *job, jobopt_T *options)
1346 {
1347  channel->ch_job = job;
1348 
1349  channel_set_options(channel, options);
1350 
1351  if (job->jv_in_buf != NULL)
1352  {
1353  chanpart_T *in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
1354 
1355  set_bufref(&in_part->ch_bufref, job->jv_in_buf);
1356  ch_log(channel, "reading from buffer '%s'",
1357  (char *)in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf->b_ffname);
1358  if (options->jo_set & JO_IN_TOP)
1359  {
1360  if (options->jo_in_top == 0 && !(options->jo_set & JO_IN_BOT))
1361  {
1362  /* Special mode: send last-but-one line when appending a line
1363  * to the buffer. */
1364  in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf->b_write_to_channel = TRUE;
1365  in_part->ch_buf_append = TRUE;
1366  in_part->ch_buf_top =
1367  in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count + 1;
1368  }
1369  else
1370  in_part->ch_buf_top = options->jo_in_top;
1371  }
1372  else
1373  in_part->ch_buf_top = 1;
1374  if (options->jo_set & JO_IN_BOT)
1375  in_part->ch_buf_bot = options->jo_in_bot;
1376  else
1377  in_part->ch_buf_bot = in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
1378  }
1379 }
1380 
1381 /*
1382  * Set the callback for "channel"/"part" for the response with "id".
1383  */
1384  static void
1385 channel_set_req_callback(
1386  channel_T *channel,
1387  ch_part_T part,
1388  callback_T *callback,
1389  int id)
1390 {
1391  cbq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_cb_head;
1392  cbq_T *item = ALLOC_ONE(cbq_T);
1393 
1394  if (item != NULL)
1395  {
1396  copy_callback(&item->cq_callback, callback);
1397  item->cq_seq_nr = id;
1398  item->cq_prev = head->cq_prev;
1399  head->cq_prev = item;
1400  item->cq_next = NULL;
1401  if (item->cq_prev == NULL)
1402  head->cq_next = item;
1403  else
1404  item->cq_prev->cq_next = item;
1405  }
1406 }
1407 
1408  static void
1409 write_buf_line(buf_T *buf, linenr_T lnum, channel_T *channel)
1410 {
1411  char_u *line = ml_get_buf(buf, lnum, FALSE);
1412  int len = (int)STRLEN(line);
1413  char_u *p;
1414  int i;
1415 
1416  /* Need to make a copy to be able to append a NL. */
1417  if ((p = alloc(len + 2)) == NULL)
1418  return;
1419  memcpy((char *)p, (char *)line, len);
1420 
1421  if (channel->ch_write_text_mode)
1422  p[len] = CAR;
1423  else
1424  {
1425  for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
1426  if (p[i] == NL)
1427  p[i] = NUL;
1428 
1429  p[len] = NL;
1430  }
1431  p[len + 1] = NUL;
1432  channel_send(channel, PART_IN, p, len + 1, "write_buf_line");
1433  vim_free(p);
1434 }
1435 
1436 /*
1437  * Return TRUE if "channel" can be written to.
1438  * Returns FALSE if the input is closed or the write would block.
1439  */
1440  static int
1441 can_write_buf_line(channel_T *channel)
1442 {
1443  chanpart_T *in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
1444 
1445  if (in_part->ch_fd == INVALID_FD)
1446  return FALSE; /* pipe was closed */
1447 
1448  /* for testing: block every other attempt to write */
1449  if (in_part->ch_block_write == 1)
1450  in_part->ch_block_write = -1;
1451  else if (in_part->ch_block_write == -1)
1452  in_part->ch_block_write = 1;
1453 
1454  /* TODO: Win32 implementation, probably using WaitForMultipleObjects() */
1455 #ifndef MSWIN
1456  {
1457 # if defined(HAVE_SELECT)
1458  struct timeval tval;
1459  fd_set wfds;
1460  int ret;
1461 
1462  FD_ZERO(&wfds);
1463  FD_SET((int)in_part->ch_fd, &wfds);
1464  tval.tv_sec = 0;
1465  tval.tv_usec = 0;
1466  for (;;)
1467  {
1468  ret = select((int)in_part->ch_fd + 1, NULL, &wfds, NULL, &tval);
1469 # ifdef EINTR
1470  SOCK_ERRNO;
1471  if (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR)
1472  continue;
1473 # endif
1474  if (ret <= 0 || in_part->ch_block_write == 1)
1475  {
1476  if (ret > 0)
1477  ch_log(channel, "FAKED Input not ready for writing");
1478  else
1479  ch_log(channel, "Input not ready for writing");
1480  return FALSE;
1481  }
1482  break;
1483  }
1484 # else
1485  struct pollfd fds;
1486 
1487  fds.fd = in_part->ch_fd;
1488  fds.events = POLLOUT;
1489  if (poll(&fds, 1, 0) <= 0)
1490  {
1491  ch_log(channel, "Input not ready for writing");
1492  return FALSE;
1493  }
1494  if (in_part->ch_block_write == 1)
1495  {
1496  ch_log(channel, "FAKED Input not ready for writing");
1497  return FALSE;
1498  }
1499 # endif
1500  }
1501 #endif
1502  return TRUE;
1503 }
1504 
1505 /*
1506  * Write any buffer lines to the input channel.
1507  */
1508  static void
1509 channel_write_in(channel_T *channel)
1510 {
1511  chanpart_T *in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
1512  linenr_T lnum;
1513  buf_T *buf = in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf;
1514  int written = 0;
1515 
1516  if (buf == NULL || in_part->ch_buf_append)
1517  return; /* no buffer or using appending */
1518  if (!bufref_valid(&in_part->ch_bufref) || buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
1519  {
1520  /* buffer was wiped out or unloaded */
1521  ch_log(channel, "input buffer has been wiped out");
1522  in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf = NULL;
1523  return;
1524  }
1525 
1526  for (lnum = in_part->ch_buf_top; lnum <= in_part->ch_buf_bot
1527  && lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count; ++lnum)
1528  {
1529  if (!can_write_buf_line(channel))
1530  break;
1531  write_buf_line(buf, lnum, channel);
1532  ++written;
1533  }
1534 
1535  if (written == 1)
1536  ch_log(channel, "written line %d to channel", (int)lnum - 1);
1537  else if (written > 1)
1538  ch_log(channel, "written %d lines to channel", written);
1539 
1540  in_part->ch_buf_top = lnum;
1541  if (lnum > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count || lnum > in_part->ch_buf_bot)
1542  {
1543 #if defined(FEAT_TERMINAL)
1544  /* Send CTRL-D or "eof_chars" to close stdin on MS-Windows. */
1545  if (channel->ch_job != NULL)
1546  term_send_eof(channel);
1547 #endif
1548 
1549  /* Writing is done, no longer need the buffer. */
1550  in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf = NULL;
1551  ch_log(channel, "Finished writing all lines to channel");
1552 
1553  /* Close the pipe/socket, so that the other side gets EOF. */
1554  ch_close_part(channel, PART_IN);
1555  }
1556  else
1557  ch_log(channel, "Still %ld more lines to write",
1558  (long)(buf->b_ml.ml_line_count - lnum + 1));
1559 }
1560 
1561 /*
1562  * Handle buffer "buf" being freed, remove it from any channels.
1563  */
1564  void
1565 channel_buffer_free(buf_T *buf)
1566 {
1567  channel_T *channel;
1568  ch_part_T part;
1569 
1570  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
1571  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_COUNT; ++part)
1572  {
1573  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
1574 
1575  if (ch_part->ch_bufref.br_buf == buf)
1576  {
1577  ch_log(channel, "%s buffer has been wiped out",
1578  part_names[part]);
1579  ch_part->ch_bufref.br_buf = NULL;
1580  }
1581  }
1582 }
1583 
1584 /*
1585  * Write any lines waiting to be written to "channel".
1586  */
1587  static void
1588 channel_write_input(channel_T *channel)
1589 {
1590  chanpart_T *in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
1591 
1592  if (in_part->ch_writeque.wq_next != NULL)
1593  channel_send(channel, PART_IN, (char_u *)"", 0, "channel_write_input");
1594  else if (in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf != NULL)
1595  {
1596  if (in_part->ch_buf_append)
1597  channel_write_new_lines(in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf);
1598  else
1599  channel_write_in(channel);
1600  }
1601 }
1602 
1603 /*
1604  * Write any lines waiting to be written to a channel.
1605  */
1606  void
1607 channel_write_any_lines(void)
1608 {
1609  channel_T *channel;
1610 
1611  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
1612  channel_write_input(channel);
1613 }
1614 
1615 /*
1616  * Write appended lines above the last one in "buf" to the channel.
1617  */
1618  void
1619 channel_write_new_lines(buf_T *buf)
1620 {
1621  channel_T *channel;
1622  int found_one = FALSE;
1623 
1624  /* There could be more than one channel for the buffer, loop over all of
1625  * them. */
1626  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
1627  {
1628  chanpart_T *in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
1629  linenr_T lnum;
1630  int written = 0;
1631 
1632  if (in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf == buf && in_part->ch_buf_append)
1633  {
1634  if (in_part->ch_fd == INVALID_FD)
1635  continue; /* pipe was closed */
1636  found_one = TRUE;
1637  for (lnum = in_part->ch_buf_bot; lnum < buf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
1638  ++lnum)
1639  {
1640  if (!can_write_buf_line(channel))
1641  break;
1642  write_buf_line(buf, lnum, channel);
1643  ++written;
1644  }
1645 
1646  if (written == 1)
1647  ch_log(channel, "written line %d to channel", (int)lnum - 1);
1648  else if (written > 1)
1649  ch_log(channel, "written %d lines to channel", written);
1650  if (lnum < buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
1651  ch_log(channel, "Still %ld more lines to write",
1652  (long)(buf->b_ml.ml_line_count - lnum));
1653 
1654  in_part->ch_buf_bot = lnum;
1655  }
1656  }
1657  if (!found_one)
1658  buf->b_write_to_channel = FALSE;
1659 }
1660 
1661 /*
1662  * Invoke the "callback" on channel "channel".
1663  * This does not redraw but sets channel_need_redraw;
1664  */
1665  static void
1666 invoke_callback(channel_T *channel, callback_T *callback, typval_T *argv)
1667 {
1668  typval_T rettv;
1669 
1670  if (safe_to_invoke_callback == 0)
1671  iemsg("INTERNAL: Invoking callback when it is not safe");
1672 
1673  argv[0].v_type = VAR_CHANNEL;
1674  argv[0].vval.v_channel = channel;
1675 
1676  call_callback(callback, -1, &rettv, 2, argv);
1677  clear_tv(&rettv);
1678  channel_need_redraw = TRUE;
1679 }
1680 
1681 /*
1682  * Return the first node from "channel"/"part" without removing it.
1683  * Returns NULL if there is nothing.
1684  */
1685  readq_T *
1686 channel_peek(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
1687 {
1688  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1689 
1690  return head->rq_next;
1691 }
1692 
1693 /*
1694  * Return a pointer to the first NL in "node".
1695  * Skips over NUL characters.
1696  * Returns NULL if there is no NL.
1697  */
1698  char_u *
1699 channel_first_nl(readq_T *node)
1700 {
1701  char_u *buffer = node->rq_buffer;
1702  long_u i;
1703 
1704  for (i = 0; i < node->rq_buflen; ++i)
1705  if (buffer[i] == NL)
1706  return buffer + i;
1707  return NULL;
1708 }
1709 
1710 /*
1711  * Return the first buffer from channel "channel"/"part" and remove it.
1712  * The caller must free it.
1713  * Returns NULL if there is nothing.
1714  */
1715  char_u *
1716 channel_get(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int *outlen)
1717 {
1718  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1719  readq_T *node = head->rq_next;
1720  char_u *p;
1721 
1722  if (node == NULL)
1723  return NULL;
1724  if (outlen != NULL)
1725  *outlen += node->rq_buflen;
1726  /* dispose of the node but keep the buffer */
1727  p = node->rq_buffer;
1728  head->rq_next = node->rq_next;
1729  if (node->rq_next == NULL)
1730  head->rq_prev = NULL;
1731  else
1732  node->rq_next->rq_prev = NULL;
1733  vim_free(node);
1734  return p;
1735 }
1736 
1737 /*
1738  * Returns the whole buffer contents concatenated for "channel"/"part".
1739  * Replaces NUL bytes with NL.
1740  */
1741  static char_u *
1742 channel_get_all(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int *outlen)
1743 {
1744  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1745  readq_T *node;
1746  long_u len = 0;
1747  char_u *res;
1748  char_u *p;
1749 
1750  // Concatenate everything into one buffer.
1751  for (node = head->rq_next; node != NULL; node = node->rq_next)
1752  len += node->rq_buflen;
1753  res = alloc(len + 1);
1754  if (res == NULL)
1755  return NULL;
1756  p = res;
1757  for (node = head->rq_next; node != NULL; node = node->rq_next)
1758  {
1759  mch_memmove(p, node->rq_buffer, node->rq_buflen);
1760  p += node->rq_buflen;
1761  }
1762  *p = NUL;
1763 
1764  // Free all buffers
1765  do
1766  {
1767  p = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
1768  vim_free(p);
1769  } while (p != NULL);
1770 
1771  if (outlen != NULL)
1772  {
1773  // Returning the length, keep NUL characters.
1774  *outlen += len;
1775  return res;
1776  }
1777 
1778  // Turn all NUL into NL, so that the result can be used as a string.
1779  p = res;
1780  while (p < res + len)
1781  {
1782  if (*p == NUL)
1783  *p = NL;
1784 #ifdef MSWIN
1785  else if (*p == 0x1b)
1786  {
1787  // crush the escape sequence OSC 0/1/2: ESC ]0;
1788  if (p + 3 < res + len
1789  && p[1] == ']'
1790  && (p[2] == '0' || p[2] == '1' || p[2] == '2')
1791  && p[3] == ';')
1792  {
1793  // '\a' becomes a NL
1794  while (p < res + (len - 1) && *p != '\a')
1795  ++p;
1796  // BEL is zero width characters, suppress display mistake
1797  // ConPTY (after 10.0.18317) requires advance checking
1798  if (p[-1] == NUL)
1799  p[-1] = 0x07;
1800  }
1801  }
1802 #endif
1803  ++p;
1804  }
1805 
1806  return res;
1807 }
1808 
1809 /*
1810  * Consume "len" bytes from the head of "node".
1811  * Caller must check these bytes are available.
1812  */
1813  void
1814 channel_consume(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int len)
1815 {
1816  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1817  readq_T *node = head->rq_next;
1818  char_u *buf = node->rq_buffer;
1819 
1820  mch_memmove(buf, buf + len, node->rq_buflen - len);
1821  node->rq_buflen -= len;
1822  node->rq_buffer[node->rq_buflen] = NUL;
1823 }
1824 
1825 /*
1826  * Collapses the first and second buffer for "channel"/"part".
1827  * Returns FAIL if that is not possible.
1828  * When "want_nl" is TRUE collapse more buffers until a NL is found.
1829  */
1830  int
1831 channel_collapse(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int want_nl)
1832 {
1833  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1834  readq_T *node = head->rq_next;
1835  readq_T *last_node;
1836  readq_T *n;
1837  char_u *newbuf;
1838  char_u *p;
1839  long_u len;
1840 
1841  if (node == NULL || node->rq_next == NULL)
1842  return FAIL;
1843 
1844  last_node = node->rq_next;
1845  len = node->rq_buflen + last_node->rq_buflen;
1846  if (want_nl)
1847  while (last_node->rq_next != NULL
1848  && channel_first_nl(last_node) == NULL)
1849  {
1850  last_node = last_node->rq_next;
1851  len += last_node->rq_buflen;
1852  }
1853 
1854  p = newbuf = alloc(len + 1);
1855  if (newbuf == NULL)
1856  return FAIL; /* out of memory */
1857  mch_memmove(p, node->rq_buffer, node->rq_buflen);
1858  p += node->rq_buflen;
1859  vim_free(node->rq_buffer);
1860  node->rq_buffer = newbuf;
1861  for (n = node; n != last_node; )
1862  {
1863  n = n->rq_next;
1864  mch_memmove(p, n->rq_buffer, n->rq_buflen);
1865  p += n->rq_buflen;
1866  vim_free(n->rq_buffer);
1867  }
1868  *p = NUL;
1869  node->rq_buflen = (long_u)(p - newbuf);
1870 
1871  /* dispose of the collapsed nodes and their buffers */
1872  for (n = node->rq_next; n != last_node; )
1873  {
1874  n = n->rq_next;
1875  vim_free(n->rq_prev);
1876  }
1877  node->rq_next = last_node->rq_next;
1878  if (last_node->rq_next == NULL)
1879  head->rq_prev = node;
1880  else
1881  last_node->rq_next->rq_prev = node;
1882  vim_free(last_node);
1883  return OK;
1884 }
1885 
1886 /*
1887  * Store "buf[len]" on "channel"/"part".
1888  * When "prepend" is TRUE put in front, otherwise append at the end.
1889  * Returns OK or FAIL.
1890  */
1891  static int
1892 channel_save(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, char_u *buf, int len,
1893  int prepend, char *lead)
1894 {
1895  readq_T *node;
1896  readq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_head;
1897  char_u *p;
1898  int i;
1899 
1900  node = ALLOC_ONE(readq_T);
1901  if (node == NULL)
1902  return FAIL; /* out of memory */
1903  /* A NUL is added at the end, because netbeans code expects that.
1904  * Otherwise a NUL may appear inside the text. */
1905  node->rq_buffer = alloc(len + 1);
1906  if (node->rq_buffer == NULL)
1907  {
1908  vim_free(node);
1909  return FAIL; /* out of memory */
1910  }
1911 
1912  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_mode == MODE_NL)
1913  {
1914  /* Drop any CR before a NL. */
1915  p = node->rq_buffer;
1916  for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
1917  if (buf[i] != CAR || i + 1 >= len || buf[i + 1] != NL)
1918  *p++ = buf[i];
1919  *p = NUL;
1920  node->rq_buflen = (long_u)(p - node->rq_buffer);
1921  }
1922  else
1923  {
1924  mch_memmove(node->rq_buffer, buf, len);
1925  node->rq_buffer[len] = NUL;
1926  node->rq_buflen = (long_u)len;
1927  }
1928 
1929  if (prepend)
1930  {
1931  // prepend node to the head of the queue
1932  node->rq_next = head->rq_next;
1933  node->rq_prev = NULL;
1934  if (head->rq_next == NULL)
1935  head->rq_prev = node;
1936  else
1937  head->rq_next->rq_prev = node;
1938  head->rq_next = node;
1939  }
1940  else
1941  {
1942  // append node to the tail of the queue
1943  node->rq_next = NULL;
1944  node->rq_prev = head->rq_prev;
1945  if (head->rq_prev == NULL)
1946  head->rq_next = node;
1947  else
1948  head->rq_prev->rq_next = node;
1949  head->rq_prev = node;
1950  }
1951 
1952  if (ch_log_active() && lead != NULL)
1953  {
1954  ch_log_lead(lead, channel, part);
1955  fprintf(log_fd, "'");
1956  vim_ignored = (int)fwrite(buf, len, 1, log_fd);
1957  fprintf(log_fd, "'\n");
1958  }
1959  return OK;
1960 }
1961 
1962 /*
1963  * Try to fill the buffer of "reader".
1964  * Returns FALSE when nothing was added.
1965  */
1966  static int
1967 channel_fill(js_read_T *reader)
1968 {
1969  channel_T *channel = (channel_T *)reader->js_cookie;
1970  ch_part_T part = reader->js_cookie_arg;
1971  char_u *next = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
1972  int keeplen;
1973  int addlen;
1974  char_u *p;
1975 
1976  if (next == NULL)
1977  return FALSE;
1978 
1979  keeplen = reader->js_end - reader->js_buf;
1980  if (keeplen > 0)
1981  {
1982  /* Prepend unused text. */
1983  addlen = (int)STRLEN(next);
1984  p = alloc(keeplen + addlen + 1);
1985  if (p == NULL)
1986  {
1987  vim_free(next);
1988  return FALSE;
1989  }
1990  mch_memmove(p, reader->js_buf, keeplen);
1991  mch_memmove(p + keeplen, next, addlen + 1);
1992  vim_free(next);
1993  next = p;
1994  }
1995 
1996  vim_free(reader->js_buf);
1997  reader->js_buf = next;
1998  return TRUE;
1999 }
2000 
2001 /*
2002  * Use the read buffer of "channel"/"part" and parse a JSON message that is
2003  * complete. The messages are added to the queue.
2004  * Return TRUE if there is more to read.
2005  */
2006  static int
2007 channel_parse_json(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
2008 {
2009  js_read_T reader;
2010  typval_T listtv;
2011  jsonq_T *item;
2012  chanpart_T *chanpart = &channel->ch_part[part];
2013  jsonq_T *head = &chanpart->ch_json_head;
2014  int status;
2015  int ret;
2016 
2017  if (channel_peek(channel, part) == NULL)
2018  return FALSE;
2019 
2020  reader.js_buf = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
2021  reader.js_used = 0;
2022  reader.js_fill = channel_fill;
2023  reader.js_cookie = channel;
2024  reader.js_cookie_arg = part;
2025 
2026  /* When a message is incomplete we wait for a short while for more to
2027  * arrive. After the delay drop the input, otherwise a truncated string
2028  * or list will make us hang.
2029  * Do not generate error messages, they will be written in a channel log. */
2030  ++emsg_silent;
2031  status = json_decode(&reader, &listtv,
2032  chanpart->ch_mode == MODE_JS ? JSON_JS : 0);
2033  --emsg_silent;
2034  if (status == OK)
2035  {
2036  /* Only accept the response when it is a list with at least two
2037  * items. */
2038  if (listtv.v_type != VAR_LIST || listtv.vval.v_list->lv_len < 2)
2039  {
2040  if (listtv.v_type != VAR_LIST)
2041  ch_error(channel, "Did not receive a list, discarding");
2042  else
2043  ch_error(channel, "Expected list with two items, got %d",
2044  listtv.vval.v_list->lv_len);
2045  clear_tv(&listtv);
2046  }
2047  else
2048  {
2049  item = ALLOC_ONE(jsonq_T);
2050  if (item == NULL)
2051  clear_tv(&listtv);
2052  else
2053  {
2054  item->jq_no_callback = FALSE;
2055  item->jq_value = alloc_tv();
2056  if (item->jq_value == NULL)
2057  {
2058  vim_free(item);
2059  clear_tv(&listtv);
2060  }
2061  else
2062  {
2063  *item->jq_value = listtv;
2064  item->jq_prev = head->jq_prev;
2065  head->jq_prev = item;
2066  item->jq_next = NULL;
2067  if (item->jq_prev == NULL)
2068  head->jq_next = item;
2069  else
2070  item->jq_prev->jq_next = item;
2071  }
2072  }
2073  }
2074  }
2075 
2076  if (status == OK)
2077  chanpart->ch_wait_len = 0;
2078  else if (status == MAYBE)
2079  {
2080  size_t buflen = STRLEN(reader.js_buf);
2081 
2082  if (chanpart->ch_wait_len < buflen)
2083  {
2084  /* First time encountering incomplete message or after receiving
2085  * more (but still incomplete): set a deadline of 100 msec. */
2086  ch_log(channel,
2087  "Incomplete message (%d bytes) - wait 100 msec for more",
2088  (int)buflen);
2089  reader.js_used = 0;
2090  chanpart->ch_wait_len = buflen;
2091 #ifdef MSWIN
2092  chanpart->ch_deadline = GetTickCount() + 100L;
2093 #else
2094  gettimeofday(&chanpart->ch_deadline, NULL);
2095  chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_usec += 100 * 1000;
2096  if (chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_usec > 1000 * 1000)
2097  {
2098  chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_usec -= 1000 * 1000;
2099  ++chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_sec;
2100  }
2101 #endif
2102  }
2103  else
2104  {
2105  int timeout;
2106 #ifdef MSWIN
2107  timeout = GetTickCount() > chanpart->ch_deadline;
2108 #else
2109  {
2110  struct timeval now_tv;
2111 
2112  gettimeofday(&now_tv, NULL);
2113  timeout = now_tv.tv_sec > chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_sec
2114  || (now_tv.tv_sec == chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_sec
2115  && now_tv.tv_usec > chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_usec);
2116  }
2117 #endif
2118  if (timeout)
2119  {
2120  status = FAIL;
2121  chanpart->ch_wait_len = 0;
2122  ch_log(channel, "timed out");
2123  }
2124  else
2125  {
2126  reader.js_used = 0;
2127  ch_log(channel, "still waiting on incomplete message");
2128  }
2129  }
2130  }
2131 
2132  if (status == FAIL)
2133  {
2134  ch_error(channel, "Decoding failed - discarding input");
2135  ret = FALSE;
2136  chanpart->ch_wait_len = 0;
2137  }
2138  else if (reader.js_buf[reader.js_used] != NUL)
2139  {
2140  /* Put the unread part back into the channel. */
2141  channel_save(channel, part, reader.js_buf + reader.js_used,
2142  (int)(reader.js_end - reader.js_buf) - reader.js_used,
2143  TRUE, NULL);
2144  ret = status == MAYBE ? FALSE: TRUE;
2145  }
2146  else
2147  ret = FALSE;
2148 
2149  vim_free(reader.js_buf);
2150  return ret;
2151 }
2152 
2153 /*
2154  * Remove "node" from the queue that it is in. Does not free it.
2155  */
2156  static void
2157 remove_cb_node(cbq_T *head, cbq_T *node)
2158 {
2159  if (node->cq_prev == NULL)
2160  head->cq_next = node->cq_next;
2161  else
2162  node->cq_prev->cq_next = node->cq_next;
2163  if (node->cq_next == NULL)
2164  head->cq_prev = node->cq_prev;
2165  else
2166  node->cq_next->cq_prev = node->cq_prev;
2167 }
2168 
2169 /*
2170  * Remove "node" from the queue that it is in and free it.
2171  * Caller should have freed or used node->jq_value.
2172  */
2173  static void
2174 remove_json_node(jsonq_T *head, jsonq_T *node)
2175 {
2176  if (node->jq_prev == NULL)
2177  head->jq_next = node->jq_next;
2178  else
2179  node->jq_prev->jq_next = node->jq_next;
2180  if (node->jq_next == NULL)
2181  head->jq_prev = node->jq_prev;
2182  else
2183  node->jq_next->jq_prev = node->jq_prev;
2184  vim_free(node);
2185 }

2187 /*
2188  * Add "id" to the list of JSON message IDs we are waiting on.
2189  */
2190  static void
2191 channel_add_block_id(chanpart_T *chanpart, int id)
2192 {
2193  garray_T *gap = &chanpart->ch_block_ids;
2194 
2195  if (gap->ga_growsize == 0)
2196  ga_init2(gap, (int)sizeof(int), 10);
2197  if (ga_grow(gap, 1) == OK)
2198  {
2199  ((int *)gap->ga_data)[gap->ga_len] = id;
2200  ++gap->ga_len;
2201  }
2202 }
2203 
2204 /*
2205  * Remove "id" from the list of JSON message IDs we are waiting on.
2206  */
2207  static void
2208 channel_remove_block_id(chanpart_T *chanpart, int id)
2209 {
2210  garray_T *gap = &chanpart->ch_block_ids;
2211  int i;
2212 
2213  for (i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i)
2214  if (((int *)gap->ga_data)[i] == id)
2215  {
2216  --gap->ga_len;
2217  if (i < gap->ga_len)
2218  {
2219  int *p = ((int *)gap->ga_data) + i;
2220 
2221  mch_memmove(p, p + 1, (gap->ga_len - i) * sizeof(int));
2222  }
2223  return;
2224  }
2225  siemsg("INTERNAL: channel_remove_block_id: cannot find id %d", id);
2226 }
2227 
2228 /*
2229  * Return TRUE if "id" is in the list of JSON message IDs we are waiting on.
2230  */
2231  static int
2232 channel_has_block_id(chanpart_T *chanpart, int id)
2233 {
2234  garray_T *gap = &chanpart->ch_block_ids;
2235  int i;
2236 
2237  for (i = 0; i < gap->ga_len; ++i)
2238  if (((int *)gap->ga_data)[i] == id)
2239  return TRUE;
2240  return FALSE;
2241 }
2242 
2243 /*
2244  * Get a message from the JSON queue for channel "channel".
2245  * When "id" is positive it must match the first number in the list.
2246  * When "id" is zero or negative jut get the first message. But not one
2247  * in the ch_block_ids list.
2248  * When "without_callback" is TRUE also get messages that were pushed back.
2249  * Return OK when found and return the value in "rettv".
2250  * Return FAIL otherwise.
2251  */
2252  static int
2253 channel_get_json(
2254  channel_T *channel,
2255  ch_part_T part,
2256  int id,
2257  int without_callback,
2258  typval_T **rettv)
2259 {
2260  jsonq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_json_head;
2261  jsonq_T *item = head->jq_next;
2262 
2263  while (item != NULL)
2264  {
2265  list_T *l = item->jq_value->vval.v_list;
2266  typval_T *tv = &l->lv_first->li_tv;
2267 
2268  if ((without_callback || !item->jq_no_callback)
2269  && ((id > 0 && tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER && tv->vval.v_number == id)
2270  || (id <= 0 && (tv->v_type != VAR_NUMBER
2271  || tv->vval.v_number == 0
2272  || !channel_has_block_id(
2273  &channel->ch_part[part], tv->vval.v_number)))))
2274  {
2275  *rettv = item->jq_value;
2276  if (tv->v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
2277  ch_log(channel, "Getting JSON message %ld",
2278  (long)tv->vval.v_number);
2279  remove_json_node(head, item);
2280  return OK;
2281  }
2282  item = item->jq_next;
2283  }
2284  return FAIL;
2285 }
2286 
2287 /*
2288  * Put back "rettv" into the JSON queue, there was no callback for it.
2289  * Takes over the values in "rettv".
2290  */
2291  static void
2292 channel_push_json(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, typval_T *rettv)
2293 {
2294  jsonq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_json_head;
2295  jsonq_T *item = head->jq_next;
2296  jsonq_T *newitem;
2297 
2298  if (head->jq_prev != NULL && head->jq_prev->jq_no_callback)
2299  /* last item was pushed back, append to the end */
2300  item = NULL;
2301  else while (item != NULL && item->jq_no_callback)
2302  /* append after the last item that was pushed back */
2303  item = item->jq_next;
2304 
2305  newitem = ALLOC_ONE(jsonq_T);
2306  if (newitem == NULL)
2307  clear_tv(rettv);
2308  else
2309  {
2310  newitem->jq_value = alloc_tv();
2311  if (newitem->jq_value == NULL)
2312  {
2313  vim_free(newitem);
2314  clear_tv(rettv);
2315  }
2316  else
2317  {
2318  newitem->jq_no_callback = FALSE;
2319  *newitem->jq_value = *rettv;
2320  if (item == NULL)
2321  {
2322  /* append to the end */
2323  newitem->jq_prev = head->jq_prev;
2324  head->jq_prev = newitem;
2325  newitem->jq_next = NULL;
2326  if (newitem->jq_prev == NULL)
2327  head->jq_next = newitem;
2328  else
2329  newitem->jq_prev->jq_next = newitem;
2330  }
2331  else
2332  {
2333  /* append after "item" */
2334  newitem->jq_prev = item;
2335  newitem->jq_next = item->jq_next;
2336  item->jq_next = newitem;
2337  if (newitem->jq_next == NULL)
2338  head->jq_prev = newitem;
2339  else
2340  newitem->jq_next->jq_prev = newitem;
2341  }
2342  }
2343  }
2344 }

2346 #define CH_JSON_MAX_ARGS 4
2347 
2348 /*
2349  * Execute a command received over "channel"/"part"
2350  * "argv[0]" is the command string.
2351  * "argv[1]" etc. have further arguments, type is VAR_UNKNOWN if missing.
2352  */
2353  static void
2354 channel_exe_cmd(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, typval_T *argv)
2355 {
2356  char_u *cmd = argv[0].vval.v_string;
2357  char_u *arg;
2358  int options = channel->ch_part[part].ch_mode == MODE_JS ? JSON_JS : 0;
2359 
2360  if (argv[1].v_type != VAR_STRING)
2361  {
2362  ch_error(channel, "received command with non-string argument");
2363  if (p_verbose > 2)
2364  emsg(_("E903: received command with non-string argument"));
2365  return;
2366  }
2367  arg = argv[1].vval.v_string;
2368  if (arg == NULL)
2369  arg = (char_u *)"";
2370 
2371  if (STRCMP(cmd, "ex") == 0)
2372  {
2373  int save_called_emsg = called_emsg;
2374 
2375  called_emsg = FALSE;
2376  ch_log(channel, "Executing ex command '%s'", (char *)arg);
2377  ++emsg_silent;
2378  do_cmdline_cmd(arg);
2379  --emsg_silent;
2380  if (called_emsg)
2381  ch_log(channel, "Ex command error: '%s'",
2382  (char *)get_vim_var_str(VV_ERRMSG));
2383  called_emsg = save_called_emsg;
2384  }
2385  else if (STRCMP(cmd, "normal") == 0)
2386  {
2387  exarg_T ea;
2388 
2389  ch_log(channel, "Executing normal command '%s'", (char *)arg);
2390  vim_memset(&ea, 0, sizeof(ea));
2391  ea.arg = arg;
2392  ea.addr_count = 0;
2393  ea.forceit = TRUE; /* no mapping */
2394  ex_normal(&ea);
2395  }
2396  else if (STRCMP(cmd, "redraw") == 0)
2397  {
2398  exarg_T ea;
2399 
2400  ch_log(channel, "redraw");
2401  vim_memset(&ea, 0, sizeof(ea));
2402  ea.forceit = *arg != NUL;
2403  ex_redraw(&ea);
2404  showruler(FALSE);
2405  setcursor();
2406  out_flush_cursor(TRUE, FALSE);
2407  }
2408  else if (STRCMP(cmd, "expr") == 0 || STRCMP(cmd, "call") == 0)
2409  {
2410  int is_call = cmd[0] == 'c';
2411  int id_idx = is_call ? 3 : 2;
2412 
2413  if (argv[id_idx].v_type != VAR_UNKNOWN
2414  && argv[id_idx].v_type != VAR_NUMBER)
2415  {
2416  ch_error(channel, "last argument for expr/call must be a number");
2417  if (p_verbose > 2)
2418  emsg(_("E904: last argument for expr/call must be a number"));
2419  }
2420  else if (is_call && argv[2].v_type != VAR_LIST)
2421  {
2422  ch_error(channel, "third argument for call must be a list");
2423  if (p_verbose > 2)
2424  emsg(_("E904: third argument for call must be a list"));
2425  }
2426  else
2427  {
2428  typval_T *tv = NULL;
2429  typval_T res_tv;
2430  typval_T err_tv;
2431  char_u *json = NULL;
2432 
2433  /* Don't pollute the display with errors. */
2434  ++emsg_skip;
2435  if (!is_call)
2436  {
2437  ch_log(channel, "Evaluating expression '%s'", (char *)arg);
2438  tv = eval_expr(arg, NULL);
2439  }
2440  else
2441  {
2442  ch_log(channel, "Calling '%s'", (char *)arg);
2443  if (func_call(arg, &argv[2], NULL, NULL, &res_tv) == OK)
2444  tv = &res_tv;
2445  }
2446 
2447  if (argv[id_idx].v_type == VAR_NUMBER)
2448  {
2449  int id = argv[id_idx].vval.v_number;
2450 
2451  if (tv != NULL)
2452  json = json_encode_nr_expr(id, tv, options | JSON_NL);
2453  if (tv == NULL || (json != NULL && *json == NUL))
2454  {
2455  /* If evaluation failed or the result can't be encoded
2456  * then return the string "ERROR". */
2457  vim_free(json);
2458  err_tv.v_type = VAR_STRING;
2459  err_tv.vval.v_string = (char_u *)"ERROR";
2460  json = json_encode_nr_expr(id, &err_tv, options | JSON_NL);
2461  }
2462  if (json != NULL)
2463  {
2464  channel_send(channel,
2465  part == PART_SOCK ? PART_SOCK : PART_IN,
2466  json, (int)STRLEN(json), (char *)cmd);
2467  vim_free(json);
2468  }
2469  }
2470  --emsg_skip;
2471  if (tv == &res_tv)
2472  clear_tv(tv);
2473  else
2474  free_tv(tv);
2475  }
2476  }
2477  else if (p_verbose > 2)
2478  {
2479  ch_error(channel, "Received unknown command: %s", (char *)cmd);
2480  semsg(_("E905: received unknown command: %s"), cmd);
2481  }
2482 }
2483 
2484 /*
2485  * Invoke the callback at "cbhead".
2486  * Does not redraw but sets channel_need_redraw.
2487  */
2488  static void
2489 invoke_one_time_callback(
2490  channel_T *channel,
2491  cbq_T *cbhead,
2492  cbq_T *item,
2493  typval_T *argv)
2494 {
2495  ch_log(channel, "Invoking one-time callback %s",
2496  (char *)item->cq_callback.cb_name);
2497  /* Remove the item from the list first, if the callback
2498  * invokes ch_close() the list will be cleared. */
2499  remove_cb_node(cbhead, item);
2500  invoke_callback(channel, &item->cq_callback, argv);
2501  free_callback(&item->cq_callback);
2502  vim_free(item);
2503 }

2505  static void
2506 append_to_buffer(buf_T *buffer, char_u *msg, channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
2507 {
2508  bufref_T save_curbuf = {NULL, 0, 0};
2509  win_T *save_curwin = NULL;
2510  tabpage_T *save_curtab = NULL;
2511  linenr_T lnum = buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
2512  int save_write_to = buffer->b_write_to_channel;
2513  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
2514  int save_p_ma = buffer->b_p_ma;
2515  int empty = (buffer->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY) ? 1 : 0;
2516 
2517  if (!buffer->b_p_ma && !ch_part->ch_nomodifiable)
2518  {
2519  if (!ch_part->ch_nomod_error)
2520  {
2521  ch_error(channel, "Buffer is not modifiable, cannot append");
2522  ch_part->ch_nomod_error = TRUE;
2523  }
2524  return;
2525  }
2526 
2527  /* If the buffer is also used as input insert above the last
2528  * line. Don't write these lines. */
2529  if (save_write_to)
2530  {
2531  --lnum;
2532  buffer->b_write_to_channel = FALSE;
2533  }
2534 
2535  /* Append to the buffer */
2536  ch_log(channel, "appending line %d to buffer", (int)lnum + 1 - empty);
2537 
2538  buffer->b_p_ma = TRUE;
2539 
2540  /* Save curbuf/curwin/curtab and make "buffer" the current buffer. */
2541  switch_to_win_for_buf(buffer, &save_curwin, &save_curtab, &save_curbuf);
2542 
2543  u_sync(TRUE);
2544  /* ignore undo failure, undo is not very useful here */
2545  vim_ignored = u_save(lnum - empty, lnum + 1);
2546 
2547  if (empty)
2548  {
2549  /* The buffer is empty, replace the first (dummy) line. */
2550  ml_replace(lnum, msg, TRUE);
2551  lnum = 0;
2552  }
2553  else
2554  ml_append(lnum, msg, 0, FALSE);
2555  appended_lines_mark(lnum, 1L);
2556 
2557  /* Restore curbuf/curwin/curtab */
2558  restore_win_for_buf(save_curwin, save_curtab, &save_curbuf);
2559 
2560  if (ch_part->ch_nomodifiable)
2561  buffer->b_p_ma = FALSE;
2562  else
2563  buffer->b_p_ma = save_p_ma;
2564 
2565  if (buffer->b_nwindows > 0)
2566  {
2567  win_T *wp;
2568 
2569  FOR_ALL_WINDOWS(wp)
2570  {
2571  if (wp->w_buffer == buffer)
2572  {
2573  int move_cursor = save_write_to
2574  ? wp->w_cursor.lnum == lnum + 1
2575  : (wp->w_cursor.lnum == lnum
2576  && wp->w_cursor.col == 0);
2577 
2578  // If the cursor is at or above the new line, move it one line
2579  // down. If the topline is outdated update it now.
2580  if (move_cursor || wp->w_topline > buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count)
2581  {
2582  if (move_cursor)
2583  ++wp->w_cursor.lnum;
2584  save_curwin = curwin;
2585  curwin = wp;
2586  curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
2587  scroll_cursor_bot(0, FALSE);
2588  curwin = save_curwin;
2589  curbuf = curwin->w_buffer;
2590  }
2591  }
2592  }
2593  redraw_buf_and_status_later(buffer, VALID);
2594  channel_need_redraw = TRUE;
2595  }
2596 
2597  if (save_write_to)
2598  {
2599  channel_T *ch;
2600 
2601  /* Find channels reading from this buffer and adjust their
2602  * next-to-read line number. */
2603  buffer->b_write_to_channel = TRUE;
2604  for (ch = first_channel; ch != NULL; ch = ch->ch_next)
2605  {
2606  chanpart_T *in_part = &ch->ch_part[PART_IN];
2607 
2608  if (in_part->ch_bufref.br_buf == buffer)
2609  in_part->ch_buf_bot = buffer->b_ml.ml_line_count;
2610  }
2611  }
2612 }
2613 
2614  static void
2615 drop_messages(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
2616 {
2617  char_u *msg;
2618 
2619  while ((msg = channel_get(channel, part, NULL)) != NULL)
2620  {
2621  ch_log(channel, "Dropping message '%s'", (char *)msg);
2622  vim_free(msg);
2623  }
2624 }
2625 
2626 /*
2627  * Invoke a callback for "channel"/"part" if needed.
2628  * This does not redraw but sets channel_need_redraw when redraw is needed.
2629  * Return TRUE when a message was handled, there might be another one.
2630  */
2631  static int
2632 may_invoke_callback(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
2633 {
2634  char_u *msg = NULL;
2635  typval_T *listtv = NULL;
2636  typval_T argv[CH_JSON_MAX_ARGS];
2637  int seq_nr = -1;
2638  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
2639  ch_mode_T ch_mode = ch_part->ch_mode;
2640  cbq_T *cbhead = &ch_part->ch_cb_head;
2641  cbq_T *cbitem;
2642  callback_T *callback = NULL;
2643  buf_T *buffer = NULL;
2644  char_u *p;
2645 
2646  if (channel->ch_nb_close_cb != NULL)
2647  /* this channel is handled elsewhere (netbeans) */
2648  return FALSE;
2649 
2650  /* Use a message-specific callback, part callback or channel callback */
2651  for (cbitem = cbhead->cq_next; cbitem != NULL; cbitem = cbitem->cq_next)
2652  if (cbitem->cq_seq_nr == 0)
2653  break;
2654  if (cbitem != NULL)
2655  callback = &cbitem->cq_callback;
2656  else if (ch_part->ch_callback.cb_name != NULL)
2657  callback = &ch_part->ch_callback;
2658  else if (channel->ch_callback.cb_name != NULL)
2659  callback = &channel->ch_callback;
2660 
2661  buffer = ch_part->ch_bufref.br_buf;
2662  if (buffer != NULL && (!bufref_valid(&ch_part->ch_bufref)
2663  || buffer->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL))
2664  {
2665  /* buffer was wiped out or unloaded */
2666  ch_log(channel, "%s buffer has been wiped out", part_names[part]);
2667  ch_part->ch_bufref.br_buf = NULL;
2668  buffer = NULL;
2669  }
2670 
2671  if (ch_mode == MODE_JSON || ch_mode == MODE_JS)
2672  {
2673  listitem_T *item;
2674  int argc = 0;
2675 
2676  /* Get any json message in the queue. */
2677  if (channel_get_json(channel, part, -1, FALSE, &listtv) == FAIL)
2678  {
2679  /* Parse readahead, return when there is still no message. */
2680  channel_parse_json(channel, part);
2681  if (channel_get_json(channel, part, -1, FALSE, &listtv) == FAIL)
2682  return FALSE;
2683  }
2684 
2685  for (item = listtv->vval.v_list->lv_first;
2686  item != NULL && argc < CH_JSON_MAX_ARGS;
2687  item = item->li_next)
2688  argv[argc++] = item->li_tv;
2689  while (argc < CH_JSON_MAX_ARGS)
2690  argv[argc++].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
2691 
2692  if (argv[0].v_type == VAR_STRING)
2693  {
2694  /* ["cmd", arg] or ["cmd", arg, arg] or ["cmd", arg, arg, arg] */
2695  channel_exe_cmd(channel, part, argv);
2696  free_tv(listtv);
2697  return TRUE;
2698  }
2699 
2700  if (argv[0].v_type != VAR_NUMBER)
2701  {
2702  ch_error(channel,
2703  "Dropping message with invalid sequence number type");
2704  free_tv(listtv);
2705  return FALSE;
2706  }
2707  seq_nr = argv[0].vval.v_number;
2708  }
2709  else if (channel_peek(channel, part) == NULL)
2710  {
2711  /* nothing to read on RAW or NL channel */
2712  return FALSE;
2713  }
2714  else
2715  {
2716  /* If there is no callback or buffer drop the message. */
2717  if (callback == NULL && buffer == NULL)
2718  {
2719  /* If there is a close callback it may use ch_read() to get the
2720  * messages. */
2721  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name == NULL && !channel->ch_drop_never)
2722  drop_messages(channel, part);
2723  return FALSE;
2724  }
2725 
2726  if (ch_mode == MODE_NL)
2727  {
2728  char_u *nl = NULL;
2729  char_u *buf;
2730  readq_T *node;
2731 
2732  /* See if we have a message ending in NL in the first buffer. If
2733  * not try to concatenate the first and the second buffer. */
2734  while (TRUE)
2735  {
2736  node = channel_peek(channel, part);
2737  nl = channel_first_nl(node);
2738  if (nl != NULL)
2739  break;
2740  if (channel_collapse(channel, part, TRUE) == FAIL)
2741  {
2742  if (ch_part->ch_fd == INVALID_FD && node->rq_buflen > 0)
2743  break;
2744  return FALSE; /* incomplete message */
2745  }
2746  }
2747  buf = node->rq_buffer;
2748 
2749  // Convert NUL to NL, the internal representation.
2750  for (p = buf; (nl == NULL || p < nl)
2751  && p < buf + node->rq_buflen; ++p)
2752  if (*p == NUL)
2753  *p = NL;
2754 
2755  if (nl == NULL)
2756  {
2757  // get the whole buffer, drop the NL
2758  msg = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
2759  }
2760  else if (nl + 1 == buf + node->rq_buflen)
2761  {
2762  // get the whole buffer
2763  msg = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
2764  *nl = NUL;
2765  }
2766  else
2767  {
2768  /* Copy the message into allocated memory (excluding the NL)
2769  * and remove it from the buffer (including the NL). */
2770  msg = vim_strnsave(buf, (int)(nl - buf));
2771  channel_consume(channel, part, (int)(nl - buf) + 1);
2772  }
2773  }
2774  else
2775  {
2776  /* For a raw channel we don't know where the message ends, just
2777  * get everything we have.
2778  * Convert NUL to NL, the internal representation. */
2779  msg = channel_get_all(channel, part, NULL);
2780  }
2781 
2782  if (msg == NULL)
2783  return FALSE; /* out of memory (and avoids Coverity warning) */
2784 
2785  argv[1].v_type = VAR_STRING;
2786  argv[1].vval.v_string = msg;
2787  }
2788 
2789  if (seq_nr > 0)
2790  {
2791  int done = FALSE;
2792 
2793  /* JSON or JS mode: invoke the one-time callback with the matching nr */
2794  for (cbitem = cbhead->cq_next; cbitem != NULL; cbitem = cbitem->cq_next)
2795  if (cbitem->cq_seq_nr == seq_nr)
2796  {
2797  invoke_one_time_callback(channel, cbhead, cbitem, argv);
2798  done = TRUE;
2799  break;
2800  }
2801  if (!done)
2802  {
2803  if (channel->ch_drop_never)
2804  {
2805  /* message must be read with ch_read() */
2806  channel_push_json(channel, part, listtv);
2807  listtv = NULL;
2808  }
2809  else
2810  ch_log(channel, "Dropping message %d without callback",
2811  seq_nr);
2812  }
2813  }
2814  else if (callback != NULL || buffer != NULL)
2815  {
2816  if (buffer != NULL)
2817  {
2818  if (msg == NULL)
2819  /* JSON or JS mode: re-encode the message. */
2820  msg = json_encode(listtv, ch_mode);
2821  if (msg != NULL)
2822  {
2823 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
2824  if (buffer->b_term != NULL)
2825  write_to_term(buffer, msg, channel);
2826  else
2827 #endif
2828  append_to_buffer(buffer, msg, channel, part);
2829  }
2830  }
2831 
2832  if (callback != NULL)
2833  {
2834  if (cbitem != NULL)
2835  invoke_one_time_callback(channel, cbhead, cbitem, argv);
2836  else
2837  {
2838  /* invoke the channel callback */
2839  ch_log(channel, "Invoking channel callback %s",
2840  (char *)callback->cb_name);
2841  invoke_callback(channel, callback, argv);
2842  }
2843  }
2844  }
2845  else
2846  ch_log(channel, "Dropping message %d", seq_nr);
2847 
2848  if (listtv != NULL)
2849  free_tv(listtv);
2850  vim_free(msg);
2851 
2852  return TRUE;
2853 }

2881 /*
2882  * Return TRUE if "channel" has JSON or other typeahead.
2883  */
2884  static int
2885 channel_has_readahead(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
2886 {
2887  ch_mode_T ch_mode = channel->ch_part[part].ch_mode;
2888 
2889  if (ch_mode == MODE_JSON || ch_mode == MODE_JS)
2890  {
2891  jsonq_T *head = &channel->ch_part[part].ch_json_head;
2892 
2893  if (head->jq_next == NULL)
2894  // Parse json from readahead, there might be a complete message to
2895  // process.
2896  channel_parse_json(channel, part);
2897 
2898  return head->jq_next != NULL;
2899  }
2900  return channel_peek(channel, part) != NULL;
2901 }

2903 /*
2904  * Return a string indicating the status of the channel.
2905  * If "req_part" is not negative check that part.
2906  */
2907  char *
2908 channel_status(channel_T *channel, int req_part)
2909 {
2910  ch_part_T part;
2911  int has_readahead = FALSE;
2912 
2913  if (channel == NULL)
2914  return "fail";
2915  if (req_part == PART_OUT)
2916  {
2917  if (channel->CH_OUT_FD != INVALID_FD)
2918  return "open";
2919  if (channel_has_readahead(channel, PART_OUT))
2920  has_readahead = TRUE;
2921  }
2922  else if (req_part == PART_ERR)
2923  {
2924  if (channel->CH_ERR_FD != INVALID_FD)
2925  return "open";
2926  if (channel_has_readahead(channel, PART_ERR))
2927  has_readahead = TRUE;
2928  }
2929  else
2930  {
2931  if (channel_is_open(channel))
2932  return "open";
2933  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
2934  if (channel_has_readahead(channel, part))
2935  {
2936  has_readahead = TRUE;
2937  break;
2938  }
2939  }
2940 
2941  if (has_readahead)
2942  return "buffered";
2943  return "closed";
2944 }

2946  static void
2947 channel_part_info(channel_T *channel, dict_T *dict, char *name, ch_part_T part)
2948 {
2949  chanpart_T *chanpart = &channel->ch_part[part];
2950  char namebuf[20]; /* longest is "sock_timeout" */
2951  size_t tail;
2952  char *status;
2953  char *s = "";
2954 
2955  vim_strncpy((char_u *)namebuf, (char_u *)name, 4);
2956  STRCAT(namebuf, "_");
2957  tail = STRLEN(namebuf);
2958 
2959  STRCPY(namebuf + tail, "status");
2960  if (chanpart->ch_fd != INVALID_FD)
2961  status = "open";
2962  else if (channel_has_readahead(channel, part))
2963  status = "buffered";
2964  else
2965  status = "closed";
2966  dict_add_string(dict, namebuf, (char_u *)status);
2967 
2968  STRCPY(namebuf + tail, "mode");
2969  switch (chanpart->ch_mode)
2970  {
2971  case MODE_NL: s = "NL"; break;
2972  case MODE_RAW: s = "RAW"; break;
2973  case MODE_JSON: s = "JSON"; break;
2974  case MODE_JS: s = "JS"; break;
2975  }
2976  dict_add_string(dict, namebuf, (char_u *)s);
2977 
2978  STRCPY(namebuf + tail, "io");
2979  if (part == PART_SOCK)
2980  s = "socket";
2981  else switch (chanpart->ch_io)
2982  {
2983  case JIO_NULL: s = "null"; break;
2984  case JIO_PIPE: s = "pipe"; break;
2985  case JIO_FILE: s = "file"; break;
2986  case JIO_BUFFER: s = "buffer"; break;
2987  case JIO_OUT: s = "out"; break;
2988  }
2989  dict_add_string(dict, namebuf, (char_u *)s);
2990 
2991  STRCPY(namebuf + tail, "timeout");
2992  dict_add_number(dict, namebuf, chanpart->ch_timeout);
2993 }

3015 /*
3016  * Close channel "channel".
3017  * Trigger the close callback if "invoke_close_cb" is TRUE.
3018  * Does not clear the buffers.
3019  */
3020  void
3021 channel_close(channel_T *channel, int invoke_close_cb)
3022 {
3023  ch_log(channel, "Closing channel");
3024 
3025 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
3026  channel_gui_unregister(channel);
3027 #endif
3028 
3029  ch_close_part(channel, PART_SOCK);
3030  ch_close_part(channel, PART_IN);
3031  ch_close_part(channel, PART_OUT);
3032  ch_close_part(channel, PART_ERR);
3033 
3034  if (invoke_close_cb)
3035  {
3036  ch_part_T part;
3037 
3038  /* Invoke callbacks and flush buffers before the close callback. */
3039  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name != NULL)
3040  ch_log(channel,
3041  "Invoking callbacks and flushing buffers before closing");
3042  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
3043  {
3044  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name != NULL
3045  || channel->ch_part[part].ch_bufref.br_buf != NULL)
3046  {
3047  /* Increment the refcount to avoid the channel being freed
3048  * halfway. */
3049  ++channel->ch_refcount;
3050  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name == NULL)
3051  ch_log(channel, "flushing %s buffers before closing",
3052  part_names[part]);
3053  while (may_invoke_callback(channel, part))
3054  ;
3055  --channel->ch_refcount;
3056  }
3057  }
3058 
3059  if (channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name != NULL)
3060  {
3061  typval_T argv[1];
3062  typval_T rettv;
3063 
3064  /* Increment the refcount to avoid the channel being freed
3065  * halfway. */
3066  ++channel->ch_refcount;
3067  ch_log(channel, "Invoking close callback %s",
3068  (char *)channel->ch_close_cb.cb_name);
3069  argv[0].v_type = VAR_CHANNEL;
3070  argv[0].vval.v_channel = channel;
3071  call_callback(&channel->ch_close_cb, -1, &rettv, 1, argv);
3072  clear_tv(&rettv);
3073  channel_need_redraw = TRUE;
3074 
3075  /* the callback is only called once */
3076  free_callback(&channel->ch_close_cb);
3077 
3078  if (channel_need_redraw)
3079  {
3080  channel_need_redraw = FALSE;
3081  redraw_after_callback(TRUE);
3082  }
3083 
3084  if (!channel->ch_drop_never)
3085  /* any remaining messages are useless now */
3086  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
3087  drop_messages(channel, part);
3088 
3089  --channel->ch_refcount;
3090  }
3091  }
3092 
3093  channel->ch_nb_close_cb = NULL;
3094 
3095 #ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
3096  term_channel_closed(channel);
3097 #endif
3098 }

3146  remove_json_node(json_head, json_head->jq_next);

3153  remove_from_writeque(&ch_part->ch_writeque,
