3247 typedef enum {
3248  CW_READY,
3249  CW_NOT_READY,
3250  CW_ERROR
3251 } channel_wait_result;
3252 
3253 /*
3254  * Check for reading from "fd" with "timeout" msec.
3255  * Return CW_READY when there is something to read.
3256  * Return CW_NOT_READY when there is nothing to read.
3257  * Return CW_ERROR when there is an error.
3258  */
3259  static channel_wait_result
3260 channel_wait(channel_T *channel, sock_T fd, int timeout)
3261 {
3262  if (timeout > 0)
3263  ch_log(channel, "Waiting for up to %d msec", timeout);
3264 
3265 # ifdef MSWIN
3266  if (fd != channel->CH_SOCK_FD)
3267  {
3268  DWORD nread;
3269  int sleep_time;
3270  DWORD deadline = GetTickCount() + timeout;
3271  int delay = 1;
3272 
3273  /* reading from a pipe, not a socket */
3274  while (TRUE)
3275  {
3276  int r = PeekNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd, NULL, 0, NULL, &nread, NULL);
3277 
3278  if (r && nread > 0)
3279  return CW_READY;
3280 
3281  if (channel->ch_named_pipe)
3282  {
3283  DisconnectNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd);
3284  ConnectNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd, NULL);
3285  }
3286  else if (r == 0)
3287  return CW_ERROR;
3288 
3289  /* perhaps write some buffer lines */
3290  channel_write_any_lines();
3291 
3292  sleep_time = deadline - GetTickCount();
3293  if (sleep_time <= 0)
3294  break;
3295  /* Wait for a little while. Very short at first, up to 10 msec
3296  * after looping a few times. */
3297  if (sleep_time > delay)
3298  sleep_time = delay;
3299  Sleep(sleep_time);
3300  delay = delay * 2;
3301  if (delay > 10)
3302  delay = 10;
3303  }
3304  }
3305  else
3306 #endif
3307  {
3308 #if defined(HAVE_SELECT)
3309  struct timeval tval;
3310  fd_set rfds;
3311  fd_set wfds;
3312  int ret;
3313  int maxfd;
3314 
3315  tval.tv_sec = timeout / 1000;
3316  tval.tv_usec = (timeout % 1000) * 1000;
3317  for (;;)
3318  {
3319  FD_ZERO(&rfds);
3320  FD_SET((int)fd, &rfds);
3321 
3322  /* Write lines to a pipe when a pipe can be written to. Need to
3323  * set this every time, some buffers may be done. */
3324  maxfd = (int)fd + 1;
3325  FD_ZERO(&wfds);
3326  maxfd = channel_fill_wfds(maxfd, &wfds);
3327 
3328  ret = select(maxfd, &rfds, &wfds, NULL, &tval);
3329 # ifdef EINTR
3330  SOCK_ERRNO;
3331  if (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR)
3332  continue;
3333 # endif
3334  if (ret > 0)
3335  {
3336  if (FD_ISSET(fd, &rfds))
3337  return CW_READY;
3338  channel_write_any_lines();
3339  continue;
3340  }
3341  break;
3342  }
3343 #else
3344  for (;;)
3345  {
3346  struct pollfd fds[MAX_OPEN_CHANNELS + 1];
3347  int nfd = 1;
3348 
3349  fds[0].fd = fd;
3350  fds[0].events = POLLIN;
3351  nfd = channel_fill_poll_write(nfd, fds);
3352  if (poll(fds, nfd, timeout) > 0)
3353  {
3354  if (fds[0].revents & POLLIN)
3355  return CW_READY;
3356  channel_write_any_lines();
3357  continue;
3358  }
3359  break;
3360  }
3361 #endif
3362  }
3363  return CW_NOT_READY;
3364 }
3365 
3366  static void
3367 ch_close_part_on_error(
3368  channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int is_err, char *func)
3369 {
3370  char msg[] = "%s(): Read %s from ch_part[%d], closing";
3371 
3372  if (is_err)
3373  /* Do not call emsg(), most likely the other end just exited. */
3374  ch_error(channel, msg, func, "error", part);
3375  else
3376  ch_log(channel, msg, func, "EOF", part);
3377 
3378  /* Queue a "DETACH" netbeans message in the command queue in order to
3379  * terminate the netbeans session later. Do not end the session here
3380  * directly as we may be running in the context of a call to
3381  * netbeans_parse_messages():
3382  * netbeans_parse_messages
3383  * -> autocmd triggered while processing the netbeans cmd
3384  * -> ui_breakcheck
3385  * -> gui event loop or select loop
3386  * -> channel_read()
3387  * Only send "DETACH" for a netbeans channel.
3388  */
3389  if (channel->ch_nb_close_cb != NULL)
3390  channel_save(channel, PART_SOCK, (char_u *)DETACH_MSG_RAW,
3391  (int)STRLEN(DETACH_MSG_RAW), FALSE, "PUT ");
3392 
3393  /* When reading is not possible close this part of the channel. Don't
3394  * close the channel yet, there may be something to read on another part.
3395  * When stdout and stderr use the same FD we get the error only on one of
3396  * them, also close the other. */
3397  if (part == PART_OUT || part == PART_ERR)
3398  {
3399  ch_part_T other = part == PART_OUT ? PART_ERR : PART_OUT;
3400 
3401  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd == channel->ch_part[other].ch_fd)
3402  ch_close_part(channel, other);
3403  }
3404  ch_close_part(channel, part);
3405 
3406 #ifdef FEAT_GUI
3407  /* Stop listening to GUI events right away. */
3408  channel_gui_unregister_one(channel, part);
3409 #endif
3410 }
3411 
3412  static void
3413 channel_close_now(channel_T *channel)
3414 {
3415  ch_log(channel, "Closing channel because all readable fds are closed");
3416  if (channel->ch_nb_close_cb != NULL)
3417  (*channel->ch_nb_close_cb)();
3418  channel_close(channel, TRUE);
3419 }
3420 
3421 /*
3422  * Read from channel "channel" for as long as there is something to read.
3423  * "part" is PART_SOCK, PART_OUT or PART_ERR.
3424  * The data is put in the read queue. No callbacks are invoked here.
3425  */
3426  static void
3427 channel_read(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, char *func)
3428 {
3429  static char_u *buf = NULL;
3430  int len = 0;
3431  int readlen = 0;
3432  sock_T fd;
3433  int use_socket = FALSE;
3434 
3435  fd = channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
3436  if (fd == INVALID_FD)
3437  {
3438  ch_error(channel, "channel_read() called while %s part is closed",
3439  part_names[part]);
3440  return;
3441  }
3442  use_socket = fd == channel->CH_SOCK_FD;
3443 
3444  /* Allocate a buffer to read into. */
3445  if (buf == NULL)
3446  {
3447  buf = alloc(MAXMSGSIZE);
3448  if (buf == NULL)
3449  return; /* out of memory! */
3450  }
3451 
3452  /* Keep on reading for as long as there is something to read.
3453  * Use select() or poll() to avoid blocking on a message that is exactly
3454  * MAXMSGSIZE long. */
3455  for (;;)
3456  {
3457  if (channel_wait(channel, fd, 0) != CW_READY)
3458  break;
3459  if (use_socket)
3460  len = sock_read(fd, (char *)buf, MAXMSGSIZE);
3461  else
3462  len = fd_read(fd, (char *)buf, MAXMSGSIZE);
3463  if (len <= 0)
3464  break; /* error or nothing more to read */
3465 
3466  /* Store the read message in the queue. */
3467  channel_save(channel, part, buf, len, FALSE, "RECV ");
3468  readlen += len;
3469  if (len < MAXMSGSIZE)
3470  break; /* did read everything that's available */
3471  }
3472 
3473  /* Reading a disconnection (readlen == 0), or an error. */
3474  if (readlen <= 0)
3475  {
3476  if (!channel->ch_keep_open)
3477  ch_close_part_on_error(channel, part, (len < 0), func);
3478  }
3479 #if defined(CH_HAS_GUI) && defined(FEAT_GUI_GTK)
3480  else if (CH_HAS_GUI && gtk_main_level() > 0)
3481  /* signal the main loop that there is something to read */
3482  gtk_main_quit();
3483 #endif
3484 }
3485 
3486 /*
3487  * Read from RAW or NL "channel"/"part". Blocks until there is something to
3488  * read or the timeout expires.
3489  * When "raw" is TRUE don't block waiting on a NL.
3490  * Does not trigger timers or handle messages.
3491  * Returns what was read in allocated memory.
3492  * Returns NULL in case of error or timeout.
3493  */
3494  static char_u *
3495 channel_read_block(
3496  channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part, int timeout, int raw, int *outlen)
3497 {
3498  char_u *buf;
3499  char_u *msg;
3500  ch_mode_T mode = channel->ch_part[part].ch_mode;
3501  sock_T fd = channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
3502  char_u *nl;
3503  readq_T *node;
3504 
3505  ch_log(channel, "Blocking %s read, timeout: %d msec",
3506  mode == MODE_RAW ? "RAW" : "NL", timeout);
3507 
3508  while (TRUE)
3509  {
3510  node = channel_peek(channel, part);
3511  if (node != NULL)
3512  {
3513  if (mode == MODE_RAW || (mode == MODE_NL
3514  && channel_first_nl(node) != NULL))
3515  /* got a complete message */
3516  break;
3517  if (channel_collapse(channel, part, mode == MODE_NL) == OK)
3518  continue;
3519  /* If not blocking or nothing more is coming then return what we
3520  * have. */
3521  if (raw || fd == INVALID_FD)
3522  break;
3523  }
3524 
3525  /* Wait for up to the channel timeout. */
3526  if (fd == INVALID_FD)
3527  return NULL;
3528  if (channel_wait(channel, fd, timeout) != CW_READY)
3529  {
3530  ch_log(channel, "Timed out");
3531  return NULL;
3532  }
3533  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_read_block");
3534  }
3535 
3536  /* We have a complete message now. */
3537  if (mode == MODE_RAW || outlen != NULL)
3538  {
3539  msg = channel_get_all(channel, part, outlen);
3540  }
3541  else
3542  {
3543  char_u *p;
3544 
3545  buf = node->rq_buffer;
3546  nl = channel_first_nl(node);
3547 
3548  /* Convert NUL to NL, the internal representation. */
3549  for (p = buf; (nl == NULL || p < nl) && p < buf + node->rq_buflen; ++p)
3550  if (*p == NUL)
3551  *p = NL;
3552 
3553  if (nl == NULL)
3554  {
3555  /* must be a closed channel with missing NL */
3556  msg = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
3557  }
3558  else if (nl + 1 == buf + node->rq_buflen)
3559  {
3560  /* get the whole buffer */
3561  msg = channel_get(channel, part, NULL);
3562  *nl = NUL;
3563  }
3564  else
3565  {
3566  /* Copy the message into allocated memory and remove it from the
3567  * buffer. */
3568  msg = vim_strnsave(buf, (int)(nl - buf));
3569  channel_consume(channel, part, (int)(nl - buf) + 1);
3570  }
3571  }
3572  if (ch_log_active())
3573  ch_log(channel, "Returning %d bytes", (int)STRLEN(msg));
3574  return msg;
3575 }
3576 
3577 static int channel_blocking_wait = 0;
3578 
3579 /*
3580  * Return TRUE if in a blocking wait that might trigger callbacks.
3581  */
3582  int
3583 channel_in_blocking_wait(void)
3584 {
3585  return channel_blocking_wait > 0;
3586 }
3587 
3588 /*
3589  * Read one JSON message with ID "id" from "channel"/"part" and store the
3590  * result in "rettv".
3591  * When "id" is -1 accept any message;
3592  * Blocks until the message is received or the timeout is reached.
3593  * In corner cases this can be called recursively, that is why ch_block_ids is
3594  * a list.
3595  */
3596  static int
3597 channel_read_json_block(
3598  channel_T *channel,
3599  ch_part_T part,
3600  int timeout_arg,
3601  int id,
3602  typval_T **rettv)
3603 {
3604  int more;
3605  sock_T fd;
3606  int timeout;
3607  chanpart_T *chanpart = &channel->ch_part[part];
3608  int retval = FAIL;
3609 
3610  ch_log(channel, "Blocking read JSON for id %d", id);
3611  ++channel_blocking_wait;
3612 
3613  if (id >= 0)
3614  channel_add_block_id(chanpart, id);
3615 
3616  for (;;)
3617  {
3618  more = channel_parse_json(channel, part);
3619 
3620  // search for message "id"
3621  if (channel_get_json(channel, part, id, TRUE, rettv) == OK)
3622  {
3623  ch_log(channel, "Received JSON for id %d", id);
3624  retval = OK;
3625  break;
3626  }
3627 
3628  if (!more)
3629  {
3630  /* Handle any other messages in the queue. If done some more
3631  * messages may have arrived. */
3632  if (channel_parse_messages())
3633  continue;
3634 
3635  /* Wait for up to the timeout. If there was an incomplete message
3636  * use the deadline for that. */
3637  timeout = timeout_arg;
3638  if (chanpart->ch_wait_len > 0)
3639  {
3640 #ifdef MSWIN
3641  timeout = chanpart->ch_deadline - GetTickCount() + 1;
3642 #else
3643  {
3644  struct timeval now_tv;
3645 
3646  gettimeofday(&now_tv, NULL);
3647  timeout = (chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_sec
3648  - now_tv.tv_sec) * 1000
3649  + (chanpart->ch_deadline.tv_usec
3650  - now_tv.tv_usec) / 1000
3651  + 1;
3652  }
3653 #endif
3654  if (timeout < 0)
3655  {
3656  /* Something went wrong, channel_parse_json() didn't
3657  * discard message. Cancel waiting. */
3658  chanpart->ch_wait_len = 0;
3659  timeout = timeout_arg;
3660  }
3661  else if (timeout > timeout_arg)
3662  timeout = timeout_arg;
3663  }
3664  fd = chanpart->ch_fd;
3665  if (fd == INVALID_FD
3666  || channel_wait(channel, fd, timeout) != CW_READY)
3667  {
3668  if (timeout == timeout_arg)
3669  {
3670  if (fd != INVALID_FD)
3671  ch_log(channel, "Timed out on id %d", id);
3672  break;
3673  }
3674  }
3675  else
3676  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_read_json_block");
3677  }
3678  }
3679  if (id >= 0)
3680  channel_remove_block_id(chanpart, id);
3681  --channel_blocking_wait;
3682 
3683  return retval;
3684 }
3685 
3686 /*
3687  * Get the channel from the argument.
3688  * Returns NULL if the handle is invalid.
3689  * When "check_open" is TRUE check that the channel can be used.
3690  * When "reading" is TRUE "check_open" considers typeahead useful.
3691  * "part" is used to check typeahead, when PART_COUNT use the default part.
3692  */
3693  static channel_T *
3694 get_channel_arg(typval_T *tv, int check_open, int reading, ch_part_T part)
3695 {
3696  channel_T *channel = NULL;
3697  int has_readahead = FALSE;
3698 
3699  if (tv->v_type == VAR_JOB)
3700  {
3701  if (tv->vval.v_job != NULL)
3702  channel = tv->vval.v_job->jv_channel;
3703  }
3704  else if (tv->v_type == VAR_CHANNEL)
3705  {
3706  channel = tv->vval.v_channel;
3707  }
3708  else
3709  {
3710  semsg(_(e_invarg2), tv_get_string(tv));
3711  return NULL;
3712  }
3713  if (channel != NULL && reading)
3714  has_readahead = channel_has_readahead(channel,
3715  part != PART_COUNT ? part : channel_part_read(channel));
3716 
3717  if (check_open && (channel == NULL || (!channel_is_open(channel)
3718  && !(reading && has_readahead))))
3719  {
3720  emsg(_("E906: not an open channel"));
3721  return NULL;
3722  }
3723  return channel;
3724 }
3725 
3726 /*
3727  * Common for ch_read() and ch_readraw().
3728  */
3729  static void
3730 common_channel_read(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int raw, int blob)
3731 {
3732  channel_T *channel;
3733  ch_part_T part = PART_COUNT;
3734  jobopt_T opt;
3735  int mode;
3736  int timeout;
3737  int id = -1;
3738  typval_T *listtv = NULL;
3739 
3740  /* return an empty string by default */
3741  rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
3742  rettv->vval.v_string = NULL;
3743 
3744  clear_job_options(&opt);
3745  if (get_job_options(&argvars[1], &opt, JO_TIMEOUT + JO_PART + JO_ID, 0)
3746  == FAIL)
3747  goto theend;
3748 
3749  if (opt.jo_set & JO_PART)
3750  part = opt.jo_part;
3751  channel = get_channel_arg(&argvars[0], TRUE, TRUE, part);
3752  if (channel != NULL)
3753  {
3754  if (part == PART_COUNT)
3755  part = channel_part_read(channel);
3756  mode = channel_get_mode(channel, part);
3757  timeout = channel_get_timeout(channel, part);
3758  if (opt.jo_set & JO_TIMEOUT)
3759  timeout = opt.jo_timeout;
3760 
3761  if (blob)
3762  {
3763  int outlen = 0;
3764  char_u *p = channel_read_block(channel, part,
3765  timeout, TRUE, &outlen);
3766  if (p != NULL)
3767  {
3768  blob_T *b = blob_alloc();
3769 
3770  if (b != NULL)
3771  {
3772  b->bv_ga.ga_len = outlen;
3773  if (ga_grow(&b->bv_ga, outlen) == FAIL)
3774  blob_free(b);
3775  else
3776  {
3777  memcpy(b->bv_ga.ga_data, p, outlen);
3778  rettv_blob_set(rettv, b);
3779  }
3780  }
3781  vim_free(p);
3782  }
3783  }
3784  else if (raw || mode == MODE_RAW || mode == MODE_NL)
3785  rettv->vval.v_string = channel_read_block(channel, part,
3786  timeout, raw, NULL);
3787  else
3788  {
3789  if (opt.jo_set & JO_ID)
3790  id = opt.jo_id;
3791  channel_read_json_block(channel, part, timeout, id, &listtv);
3792  if (listtv != NULL)
3793  {
3794  *rettv = *listtv;
3795  vim_free(listtv);
3796  }
3797  else
3798  {
3799  rettv->v_type = VAR_SPECIAL;
3800  rettv->vval.v_number = VVAL_NONE;
3801  }
3802  }
3803  }
3804 
3805 theend:
3806  free_job_options(&opt);
3807 }
3808 
3809 # if defined(MSWIN) || defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(PROTO)
3810 /*
3811  * Check the channels for anything that is ready to be read.
3812  * The data is put in the read queue.
3813  * if "only_keep_open" is TRUE only check channels where ch_keep_open is set.
3814  */
3815  void
3816 channel_handle_events(int only_keep_open)
3817 {
3818  channel_T *channel;
3819  ch_part_T part;
3820  sock_T fd;
3821 
3822  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
3823  {
3824  if (only_keep_open && !channel->ch_keep_open)
3825  continue;
3826 
3827  /* check the socket and pipes */
3828  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
3829  {
3830  fd = channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
3831  if (fd != INVALID_FD)
3832  {
3833  int r = channel_wait(channel, fd, 0);
3834 
3835  if (r == CW_READY)
3836  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_handle_events");
3837  else if (r == CW_ERROR)
3838  ch_close_part_on_error(channel, part, TRUE,
3839  "channel_handle_events");
3840  }
3841  }
3842  }
3843 }
3844 # endif
3845 
3846 # if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(PROTO)
3847 /*
3848  * Return TRUE when there is any channel with a keep_open flag.
3849  */
3850  int
3851 channel_any_keep_open()
3852 {
3853  channel_T *channel;
3854 
3855  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
3856  if (channel->ch_keep_open)
3857  return TRUE;
3858  return FALSE;
3859 }
3860 # endif
3861 
3862 /*
3863  * Set "channel"/"part" to non-blocking.
3864  * Only works for sockets and pipes.
3865  */
3866  void
3867 channel_set_nonblock(channel_T *channel, ch_part_T part)
3868 {
3869  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
3870  int fd = ch_part->ch_fd;
3871 
3872  if (fd != INVALID_FD)
3873  {
3874 #ifdef MSWIN
3875  u_long val = 1;
3876 
3877  ioctlsocket(fd, FIONBIO, &val);
3878 #else
3879  (void)fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
3880 #endif
3881  ch_part->ch_nonblocking = TRUE;
3882  }
3883 }
3884 
3885 /*
3886  * Write "buf" (NUL terminated string) to "channel"/"part".
3887  * When "fun" is not NULL an error message might be given.
3888  * Return FAIL or OK.
3889  */
3890  int
3891 channel_send(
3892  channel_T *channel,
3893  ch_part_T part,
3894  char_u *buf_arg,
3895  int len_arg,
3896  char *fun)
3897 {
3898  int res;
3899  sock_T fd;
3900  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
3901  int did_use_queue = FALSE;
3902 
3903  fd = ch_part->ch_fd;
3904  if (fd == INVALID_FD)
3905  {
3906  if (!channel->ch_error && fun != NULL)
3907  {
3908  ch_error(channel, "%s(): write while not connected", fun);
3909  semsg(_("E630: %s(): write while not connected"), fun);
3910  }
3911  channel->ch_error = TRUE;
3912  return FAIL;
3913  }
3914 
3915  if (channel->ch_nonblock && !ch_part->ch_nonblocking)
3916  channel_set_nonblock(channel, part);
3917 
3918  if (ch_log_active())
3919  {
3920  ch_log_lead("SEND ", channel, part);
3921  fprintf(log_fd, "'");
3922  vim_ignored = (int)fwrite(buf_arg, len_arg, 1, log_fd);
3923  fprintf(log_fd, "'\n");
3924  fflush(log_fd);
3925  did_repeated_msg = 0;
3926  }
3927 
3928  for (;;)
3929  {
3930  writeq_T *wq = &ch_part->ch_writeque;
3931  char_u *buf;
3932  int len;
3933 
3934  if (wq->wq_next != NULL)
3935  {
3936  /* first write what was queued */
3937  buf = wq->wq_next->wq_ga.ga_data;
3938  len = wq->wq_next->wq_ga.ga_len;
3939  did_use_queue = TRUE;
3940  }
3941  else
3942  {
3943  if (len_arg == 0)
3944  /* nothing to write, called from channel_select_check() */
3945  return OK;
3946  buf = buf_arg;
3947  len = len_arg;
3948  }
3949 
3950  if (part == PART_SOCK)
3951  res = sock_write(fd, (char *)buf, len);
3952  else
3953  {
3954  res = fd_write(fd, (char *)buf, len);
3955 #ifdef MSWIN
3956  if (channel->ch_named_pipe && res < 0)
3957  {
3958  DisconnectNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd);
3959  ConnectNamedPipe((HANDLE)fd, NULL);
3960  }
3961 #endif
3962  }
3963  if (res < 0 && (errno == EWOULDBLOCK
3964 #ifdef EAGAIN
3965  || errno == EAGAIN
3966 #endif
3967  ))
3968  res = 0; /* nothing got written */
3969 
3970  if (res >= 0 && ch_part->ch_nonblocking)
3971  {
3972  writeq_T *entry = wq->wq_next;
3973 
3974  if (did_use_queue)
3975  ch_log(channel, "Sent %d bytes now", res);
3976  if (res == len)
3977  {
3978  /* Wrote all the buf[len] bytes. */
3979  if (entry != NULL)
3980  {
3981  /* Remove the entry from the write queue. */
3982  remove_from_writeque(wq, entry);
3983  continue;
3984  }
3985  if (did_use_queue)
3986  ch_log(channel, "Write queue empty");
3987  }
3988  else
3989  {
3990  /* Wrote only buf[res] bytes, can't write more now. */
3991  if (entry != NULL)
3992  {
3993  if (res > 0)
3994  {
3995  /* Remove the bytes that were written. */
3996  mch_memmove(entry->wq_ga.ga_data,
3997  (char *)entry->wq_ga.ga_data + res,
3998  len - res);
3999  entry->wq_ga.ga_len -= res;
4000  }
4001  buf = buf_arg;
4002  len = len_arg;
4003  }
4004  else
4005  {
4006  buf += res;
4007  len -= res;
4008  }
4009  ch_log(channel, "Adding %d bytes to the write queue", len);
4010 
4011  /* Append the not written bytes of the argument to the write
4012  * buffer. Limit entries to 4000 bytes. */
4013  if (wq->wq_prev != NULL
4014  && wq->wq_prev->wq_ga.ga_len + len < 4000)
4015  {
4016  writeq_T *last = wq->wq_prev;
4017 
4018  /* append to the last entry */
4019  if (len > 0 && ga_grow(&last->wq_ga, len) == OK)
4020  {
4021  mch_memmove((char *)last->wq_ga.ga_data
4022  + last->wq_ga.ga_len,
4023  buf, len);
4024  last->wq_ga.ga_len += len;
4025  }
4026  }
4027  else
4028  {
4029  writeq_T *last = ALLOC_ONE(writeq_T);
4030 
4031  if (last != NULL)
4032  {
4033  last->wq_prev = wq->wq_prev;
4034  last->wq_next = NULL;
4035  if (wq->wq_prev == NULL)
4036  wq->wq_next = last;
4037  else
4038  wq->wq_prev->wq_next = last;
4039  wq->wq_prev = last;
4040  ga_init2(&last->wq_ga, 1, 1000);
4041  if (len > 0 && ga_grow(&last->wq_ga, len) == OK)
4042  {
4043  mch_memmove(last->wq_ga.ga_data, buf, len);
4044  last->wq_ga.ga_len = len;
4045  }
4046  }
4047  }
4048  }
4049  }
4050  else if (res != len)
4051  {
4052  if (!channel->ch_error && fun != NULL)
4053  {
4054  ch_error(channel, "%s(): write failed", fun);
4055  semsg(_("E631: %s(): write failed"), fun);
4056  }
4057  channel->ch_error = TRUE;
4058  return FAIL;
4059  }
4060 
4061  channel->ch_error = FALSE;
4062  return OK;
4063  }
4064 }
4065 
4066 /*
4067  * Common for "ch_sendexpr()" and "ch_sendraw()".
4068  * Returns the channel if the caller should read the response.
4069  * Sets "part_read" to the read fd.
4070  * Otherwise returns NULL.
4071  */
4072  static channel_T *
4073 send_common(
4074  typval_T *argvars,
4075  char_u *text,
4076  int len,
4077  int id,
4078  int eval,
4079  jobopt_T *opt,
4080  char *fun,
4081  ch_part_T *part_read)
4082 {
4083  channel_T *channel;
4084  ch_part_T part_send;
4085 
4086  clear_job_options(opt);
4087  channel = get_channel_arg(&argvars[0], TRUE, FALSE, 0);
4088  if (channel == NULL)
4089  return NULL;
4090  part_send = channel_part_send(channel);
4091  *part_read = channel_part_read(channel);
4092 
4093  if (get_job_options(&argvars[2], opt, JO_CALLBACK + JO_TIMEOUT, 0) == FAIL)
4094  return NULL;
4095 
4096  /* Set the callback. An empty callback means no callback and not reading
4097  * the response. With "ch_evalexpr()" and "ch_evalraw()" a callback is not
4098  * allowed. */
4099  if (opt->jo_callback.cb_name != NULL && *opt->jo_callback.cb_name != NUL)
4100  {
4101  if (eval)
4102  {
4103  semsg(_("E917: Cannot use a callback with %s()"), fun);
4104  return NULL;
4105  }
4106  channel_set_req_callback(channel, *part_read, &opt->jo_callback, id);
4107  }
4108 
4109  if (channel_send(channel, part_send, text, len, fun) == OK
4110  && opt->jo_callback.cb_name == NULL)
4111  return channel;
4112  return NULL;
4113 }

4115 /*
4116  * common for "ch_evalexpr()" and "ch_sendexpr()"
4117  */
4118  static void
4119 ch_expr_common(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int eval)
4120 {
4121  char_u *text;
4122  typval_T *listtv;
4123  channel_T *channel;
4124  int id;
4125  ch_mode_T ch_mode;
4126  ch_part_T part_send;
4127  ch_part_T part_read;
4128  jobopt_T opt;
4129  int timeout;
4130 
4131  /* return an empty string by default */
4132  rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4133  rettv->vval.v_string = NULL;
4134 
4135  channel = get_channel_arg(&argvars[0], TRUE, FALSE, 0);
4136  if (channel == NULL)
4137  return;
4138  part_send = channel_part_send(channel);
4139 
4140  ch_mode = channel_get_mode(channel, part_send);
4141  if (ch_mode == MODE_RAW || ch_mode == MODE_NL)
4142  {
4143  emsg(_("E912: cannot use ch_evalexpr()/ch_sendexpr() with a raw or nl channel"));
4144  return;
4145  }
4146 
4147  id = ++channel->ch_last_msg_id;
4148  text = json_encode_nr_expr(id, &argvars[1],
4149  (ch_mode == MODE_JS ? JSON_JS : 0) | JSON_NL);
4150  if (text == NULL)
4151  return;
4152 
4153  channel = send_common(argvars, text, (int)STRLEN(text), id, eval, &opt,
4154  eval ? "ch_evalexpr" : "ch_sendexpr", &part_read);
4155  vim_free(text);
4156  if (channel != NULL && eval)
4157  {
4158  if (opt.jo_set & JO_TIMEOUT)
4159  timeout = opt.jo_timeout;
4160  else
4161  timeout = channel_get_timeout(channel, part_read);
4162  if (channel_read_json_block(channel, part_read, timeout, id, &listtv)
4163  == OK)
4164  {
4165  list_T *list = listtv->vval.v_list;
4166 
4167  /* Move the item from the list and then change the type to
4168  * avoid the value being freed. */
4169  *rettv = list->lv_last->li_tv;
4170  list->lv_last->li_tv.v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
4171  free_tv(listtv);
4172  }
4173  }
4174  free_job_options(&opt);
4175 }

4177 /*
4178  * common for "ch_evalraw()" and "ch_sendraw()"
4179  */
4180  static void
4181 ch_raw_common(typval_T *argvars, typval_T *rettv, int eval)
4182 {
4183  char_u buf[NUMBUFLEN];
4184  char_u *text;
4185  int len;
4186  channel_T *channel;
4187  ch_part_T part_read;
4188  jobopt_T opt;
4189  int timeout;
4190 
4191  /* return an empty string by default */
4192  rettv->v_type = VAR_STRING;
4193  rettv->vval.v_string = NULL;
4194 
4195  if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_BLOB)
4196  {
4197  text = argvars[1].vval.v_blob->bv_ga.ga_data;
4198  len = argvars[1].vval.v_blob->bv_ga.ga_len;
4199  }
4200  else
4201  {
4202  text = tv_get_string_buf(&argvars[1], buf);
4203  len = (int)STRLEN(text);
4204  }
4205  channel = send_common(argvars, text, len, 0, eval, &opt,
4206  eval ? "ch_evalraw" : "ch_sendraw", &part_read);
4207  if (channel != NULL && eval)
4208  {
4209  if (opt.jo_set & JO_TIMEOUT)
4210  timeout = opt.jo_timeout;
4211  else
4212  timeout = channel_get_timeout(channel, part_read);
4213  rettv->vval.v_string = channel_read_block(channel, part_read,
4214  timeout, TRUE, NULL);
4215  }
4216  free_job_options(&opt);
4217 }

4219 #define KEEP_OPEN_TIME 20 /* msec */
4220 
4221 #if (defined(UNIX) && !defined(HAVE_SELECT)) || defined(PROTO)
4222 /*
4223  * Add open channels to the poll struct.
4224  * Return the adjusted struct index.
4225  * The type of "fds" is hidden to avoid problems with the function proto.
4226  */
4227  int
4228 channel_poll_setup(int nfd_in, void *fds_in, int *towait)
4229 {
4230  int nfd = nfd_in;
4231  channel_T *channel;
4232  struct pollfd *fds = fds_in;
4233  ch_part_T part;
4234 
4235  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
4236  {
4237  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
4238  {
4239  chanpart_T *ch_part = &channel->ch_part[part];
4240 
4241  if (ch_part->ch_fd != INVALID_FD)
4242  {
4243  if (channel->ch_keep_open)
4244  {
4245  /* For unknown reason poll() returns immediately for a
4246  * keep-open channel. Instead of adding it to the fds add
4247  * a short timeout and check, like polling. */
4248  if (*towait < 0 || *towait > KEEP_OPEN_TIME)
4249  *towait = KEEP_OPEN_TIME;
4250  }
4251  else
4252  {
4253  ch_part->ch_poll_idx = nfd;
4254  fds[nfd].fd = ch_part->ch_fd;
4255  fds[nfd].events = POLLIN;
4256  nfd++;
4257  }
4258  }
4259  else
4260  channel->ch_part[part].ch_poll_idx = -1;
4261  }
4262  }
4263 
4264  nfd = channel_fill_poll_write(nfd, fds);
4265 
4266  return nfd;
4267 }

4269 /*
4270  * The type of "fds" is hidden to avoid problems with the function proto.
4271  */
4272  int
4273 channel_poll_check(int ret_in, void *fds_in)
4274 {
4275  int ret = ret_in;
4276  channel_T *channel;
4277  struct pollfd *fds = fds_in;
4278  ch_part_T part;
4279  int idx;
4280  chanpart_T *in_part;
4281 
4282  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
4283  {
4284  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
4285  {
4286  idx = channel->ch_part[part].ch_poll_idx;
4287 
4288  if (ret > 0 && idx != -1 && (fds[idx].revents & POLLIN))
4289  {
4290  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_poll_check");
4291  --ret;
4292  }
4293  else if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd != INVALID_FD
4294  && channel->ch_keep_open)
4295  {
4296  /* polling a keep-open channel */
4297  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_poll_check_keep_open");
4298  }
4299  }
4300 
4301  in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
4302  idx = in_part->ch_poll_idx;
4303  if (ret > 0 && idx != -1 && (fds[idx].revents & POLLOUT))
4304  {
4305  channel_write_input(channel);
4306  --ret;
4307  }
4308  }
4309 
4310  return ret;
4311 }
4312 #endif /* UNIX && !HAVE_SELECT */
4313 
4314 #if (!defined(MSWIN) && defined(HAVE_SELECT)) || defined(PROTO)
4315 
4316 /*
4317  * The "fd_set" type is hidden to avoid problems with the function proto.
4318  */
4319  int
4320 channel_select_setup(
4321  int maxfd_in,
4322  void *rfds_in,
4323  void *wfds_in,
4324  struct timeval *tv,
4325  struct timeval **tvp)
4326 {
4327  int maxfd = maxfd_in;
4328  channel_T *channel;
4329  fd_set *rfds = rfds_in;
4330  fd_set *wfds = wfds_in;
4331  ch_part_T part;
4332 
4333  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
4334  {
4335  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
4336  {
4337  sock_T fd = channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
4338 
4339  if (fd != INVALID_FD)
4340  {
4341  if (channel->ch_keep_open)
4342  {
4343  /* For unknown reason select() returns immediately for a
4344  * keep-open channel. Instead of adding it to the rfds add
4345  * a short timeout and check, like polling. */
4346  if (*tvp == NULL || tv->tv_sec > 0
4347  || tv->tv_usec > KEEP_OPEN_TIME * 1000)
4348  {
4349  *tvp = tv;
4350  tv->tv_sec = 0;
4351  tv->tv_usec = KEEP_OPEN_TIME * 1000;
4352  }
4353  }
4354  else
4355  {
4356  FD_SET((int)fd, rfds);
4357  if (maxfd < (int)fd)
4358  maxfd = (int)fd;
4359  }
4360  }
4361  }
4362  }
4363 
4364  maxfd = channel_fill_wfds(maxfd, wfds);
4365 
4366  return maxfd;
4367 }
4368 
4369 /*
4370  * The "fd_set" type is hidden to avoid problems with the function proto.
4371  */
4372  int
4373 channel_select_check(int ret_in, void *rfds_in, void *wfds_in)
4374 {
4375  int ret = ret_in;
4376  channel_T *channel;
4377  fd_set *rfds = rfds_in;
4378  fd_set *wfds = wfds_in;
4379  ch_part_T part;
4380  chanpart_T *in_part;
4381 
4382  for (channel = first_channel; channel != NULL; channel = channel->ch_next)
4383  {
4384  for (part = PART_SOCK; part < PART_IN; ++part)
4385  {
4386  sock_T fd = channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd;
4387 
4388  if (ret > 0 && fd != INVALID_FD && FD_ISSET(fd, rfds))
4389  {
4390  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_select_check");
4391  FD_CLR(fd, rfds);
4392  --ret;
4393  }
4394  else if (fd != INVALID_FD && channel->ch_keep_open)
4395  {
4396  /* polling a keep-open channel */
4397  channel_read(channel, part, "channel_select_check_keep_open");
4398  }
4399  }
4400 
4401  in_part = &channel->ch_part[PART_IN];
4402  if (ret > 0 && in_part->ch_fd != INVALID_FD
4403  && FD_ISSET(in_part->ch_fd, wfds))
4404  {
4405  // Clear the flag first, ch_fd may change in channel_write_input().
4406  FD_CLR(in_part->ch_fd, wfds);
4407  channel_write_input(channel);
4408  --ret;
4409  }
4410  }
4411 
4412  return ret;
4413 }
4414 #endif // !MSWIN && HAVE_SELECT

4416 /*
4417  * Execute queued up commands.
4418  * Invoked from the main loop when it's safe to execute received commands,
4419  * and during a blocking wait for ch_evalexpr().
4420  * Return TRUE when something was done.
4421  */
4422  int
4423 channel_parse_messages(void)
4424 {
4425  channel_T *channel = first_channel;
4426  int ret = FALSE;
4427  int r;
4428  ch_part_T part = PART_SOCK;
4429 #ifdef ELAPSED_FUNC
4430  elapsed_T start_tv;
4431 
4432  ELAPSED_INIT(start_tv);
4433 #endif
4434 
4435  ++safe_to_invoke_callback;
4436 
4437  /* Only do this message when another message was given, otherwise we get
4438  * lots of them. */
4439  if ((did_repeated_msg & REPEATED_MSG_LOOKING) == 0)
4440  {
4441  ch_log(NULL, "looking for messages on channels");
4442  // now we should also give the message for SafeState
4443  did_repeated_msg = REPEATED_MSG_LOOKING;
4444  }
4445  while (channel != NULL)
4446  {
4447  if (channel_can_close(channel))
4448  {
4449  channel->ch_to_be_closed = (1U << PART_COUNT);
4450  channel_close_now(channel);
4451  // channel may have been freed, start over
4452  channel = first_channel;
4453  continue;
4454  }
4455  if (channel->ch_to_be_freed || channel->ch_killing)
4456  {
4457  if (channel->ch_killing)
4458  {
4459  channel_free_contents(channel);
4460  channel->ch_job->jv_channel = NULL;
4461  }
4462  channel_free(channel);
4463  // channel has been freed, start over
4464  channel = first_channel;
4465  continue;
4466  }
4467  if (channel->ch_refcount == 0 && !channel_still_useful(channel))
4468  {
4469  // channel is no longer useful, free it
4470  channel_free(channel);
4471  channel = first_channel;
4472  part = PART_SOCK;
4473  continue;
4474  }
4475  if (channel->ch_part[part].ch_fd != INVALID_FD
4476  || channel_has_readahead(channel, part))
4477  {
4478  /* Increase the refcount, in case the handler causes the channel
4479  * to be unreferenced or closed. */
4480  ++channel->ch_refcount;
4481  r = may_invoke_callback(channel, part);
4482  if (r == OK)
4483  ret = TRUE;
4484  if (channel_unref(channel) || (r == OK
4485 #ifdef ELAPSED_FUNC
4486  /* Limit the time we loop here to 100 msec, otherwise
4487  * Vim becomes unresponsive when the callback takes
4488  * more than a bit of time. */
4489  && ELAPSED_FUNC(start_tv) < 100L
4490 #endif
4491  ))
4492  {
4493  /* channel was freed or something was done, start over */
4494  channel = first_channel;
4495  part = PART_SOCK;
4496  continue;
4497  }
4498  }
4499  if (part < PART_ERR)
4500  ++part;
4501  else
4502  {
4503  channel = channel->ch_next;
4504  part = PART_SOCK;
4505  }
4506  }
4507 
4508  if (channel_need_redraw)
4509  {
4510  channel_need_redraw = FALSE;
4511  redraw_after_callback(TRUE);
4512  }
4513 
4514  --safe_to_invoke_callback;
4515 
4516  return ret;
4517 }
4518 
4519 /*
4520  * Return TRUE if any channel has readahead. That means we should not block on
4521  * waiting for input.
4522  */
4523  int
4524 channel_any_readahead(void)
4525 {
4526  channel_T *channel = first_channel;
4527  ch_part_T part = PART_SOCK;
4528 
4529  while (channel != NULL)
4530  {
4531  if (channel_has_readahead(channel, part))
4532  return TRUE;
4533  if (part < PART_ERR)
4534  ++part;
4535  else
4536  {
4537  channel = channel->ch_next;
4538  part = PART_SOCK;
4539  }
4540  }
4541  return FALSE;
4542 }

4544 /*
4545  * Mark references to lists used in channels.
4546  */
4547  int
4548 set_ref_in_channel(int copyID)
4549 {
4550  int abort = FALSE;
4551  channel_T *channel;
4552  typval_T tv;
4553 
4554  for (channel = first_channel; !abort && channel != NULL;
4555  channel = channel->ch_next)
4556  if (channel_still_useful(channel))
4557  {
4558  tv.v_type = VAR_CHANNEL;
4559  tv.vval.v_channel = channel;
4560  abort = abort || set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, NULL, NULL);
4561  }
4562  return abort;
4563 }

4608  static int
4609 handle_mode(typval_T *item, jobopt_T *opt, ch_mode_T *modep, int jo)
4610 {
4611  char_u *val = tv_get_string(item);
4612 
4613  opt->jo_set |= jo;
4614  if (STRCMP(val, "nl") == 0)
4615  *modep = MODE_NL;
4616  else if (STRCMP(val, "raw") == 0)
4617  *modep = MODE_RAW;
4618  else if (STRCMP(val, "js") == 0)
4619  *modep = MODE_JS;
4620  else if (STRCMP(val, "json") == 0)
4621  *modep = MODE_JSON;
4622  else
4623  {
4624  semsg(_(e_invarg2), val);
4625  return FAIL;
4626  }
4627  return OK;
4628 }
4629 
4630  static int
4631 handle_io(typval_T *item, ch_part_T part, jobopt_T *opt)
4632 {
4633  char_u *val = tv_get_string(item);
4634 
4635  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_IO << (part - PART_OUT);
4636  if (STRCMP(val, "null") == 0)
4637  opt->jo_io[part] = JIO_NULL;
4638  else if (STRCMP(val, "pipe") == 0)
4639  opt->jo_io[part] = JIO_PIPE;
4640  else if (STRCMP(val, "file") == 0)
4641  opt->jo_io[part] = JIO_FILE;
4642  else if (STRCMP(val, "buffer") == 0)
4643  opt->jo_io[part] = JIO_BUFFER;
4644  else if (STRCMP(val, "out") == 0 && part == PART_ERR)
4645  opt->jo_io[part] = JIO_OUT;
4646  else
4647  {
4648  semsg(_(e_invarg2), val);
4649  return FAIL;
4650  }
4651  return OK;
4652 }

4663 /*
4664  * Free any members of a jobopt_T.
4665  */
4666  static void
4667 free_job_options(jobopt_T *opt)
4668 {
4669  if (opt->jo_callback.cb_partial != NULL)
4670  partial_unref(opt->jo_callback.cb_partial);
4671  else if (opt->jo_callback.cb_name != NULL)
4672  func_unref(opt->jo_callback.cb_name);
4673  if (opt->jo_out_cb.cb_partial != NULL)
4674  partial_unref(opt->jo_out_cb.cb_partial);
4675  else if (opt->jo_out_cb.cb_name != NULL)
4676  func_unref(opt->jo_out_cb.cb_name);
4677  if (opt->jo_err_cb.cb_partial != NULL)
4678  partial_unref(opt->jo_err_cb.cb_partial);
4679  else if (opt->jo_err_cb.cb_name != NULL)
4680  func_unref(opt->jo_err_cb.cb_name);
4681  if (opt->jo_close_cb.cb_partial != NULL)
4682  partial_unref(opt->jo_close_cb.cb_partial);
4683  else if (opt->jo_close_cb.cb_name != NULL)
4684  func_unref(opt->jo_close_cb.cb_name);
4685  if (opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_partial != NULL)
4686  partial_unref(opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_partial);
4687  else if (opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_name != NULL)
4688  func_unref(opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_name);
4689  if (opt->jo_env != NULL)
4690  dict_unref(opt->jo_env);
4691 }
4692 
4693 /*
4694  * Get the PART_ number from the first character of an option name.
4695  */
4696  static int
4697 part_from_char(int c)
4698 {
4699  return c == 'i' ? PART_IN : c == 'o' ? PART_OUT: PART_ERR;
4700 }
4701 
4702 /*
4703  * Get the option entries from the dict in "tv", parse them and put the result
4704  * in "opt".
4705  * Only accept JO_ options in "supported" and JO2_ options in "supported2".
4706  * If an option value is invalid return FAIL.
4707  */
4708  int
4709 get_job_options(typval_T *tv, jobopt_T *opt, int supported, int supported2)
4710 {
4711  typval_T *item;
4712  char_u *val;
4713  dict_T *dict;
4714  int todo;
4715  hashitem_T *hi;
4716  ch_part_T part;
4717 
4718  if (tv->v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN)
4719  return OK;
4720  if (tv->v_type != VAR_DICT)
4721  {
4722  emsg(_(e_dictreq));
4723  return FAIL;
4724  }
4725  dict = tv->vval.v_dict;
4726  if (dict == NULL)
4727  return OK;
4728 
4729  todo = (int)dict->dv_hashtab.ht_used;
4730  for (hi = dict->dv_hashtab.ht_array; todo > 0; ++hi)
4731  if (!HASHITEM_EMPTY(hi))
4732  {
4733  item = &dict_lookup(hi)->di_tv;
4734 
4735  if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "mode") == 0)
4736  {
4737  if (!(supported & JO_MODE))
4738  break;
4739  if (handle_mode(item, opt, &opt->jo_mode, JO_MODE) == FAIL)
4740  return FAIL;
4741  }
4742  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_mode") == 0)
4743  {
4744  if (!(supported & JO_IN_MODE))
4745  break;
4746  if (handle_mode(item, opt, &opt->jo_in_mode, JO_IN_MODE)
4747  == FAIL)
4748  return FAIL;
4749  }
4750  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_mode") == 0)
4751  {
4752  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_MODE))
4753  break;
4754  if (handle_mode(item, opt, &opt->jo_out_mode, JO_OUT_MODE)
4755  == FAIL)
4756  return FAIL;
4757  }
4758  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_mode") == 0)
4759  {
4760  if (!(supported & JO_ERR_MODE))
4761  break;
4762  if (handle_mode(item, opt, &opt->jo_err_mode, JO_ERR_MODE)
4763  == FAIL)
4764  return FAIL;
4765  }
4766  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "noblock") == 0)
4767  {
4768  if (!(supported & JO_MODE))
4769  break;
4770  opt->jo_noblock = tv_get_number(item);
4771  }
4772  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_io") == 0
4773  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_io") == 0
4774  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_io") == 0)
4775  {
4776  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4777  break;
4778  if (handle_io(item, part_from_char(*hi->hi_key), opt) == FAIL)
4779  return FAIL;
4780  }
4781  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_name") == 0
4782  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_name") == 0
4783  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_name") == 0)
4784  {
4785  part = part_from_char(*hi->hi_key);
4786 
4787  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4788  break;
4789  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_NAME << (part - PART_OUT);
4790  opt->jo_io_name[part] =
4791  tv_get_string_buf_chk(item, opt->jo_io_name_buf[part]);
4792  }
4793  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "pty") == 0)
4794  {
4795  if (!(supported & JO_MODE))
4796  break;
4797  opt->jo_pty = tv_get_number(item);
4798  }
4799  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_buf") == 0
4800  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_buf") == 0
4801  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_buf") == 0)
4802  {
4803  part = part_from_char(*hi->hi_key);
4804 
4805  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4806  break;
4807  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_BUF << (part - PART_OUT);
4808  opt->jo_io_buf[part] = tv_get_number(item);
4809  if (opt->jo_io_buf[part] <= 0)
4810  {
4811  semsg(_(e_invargNval), hi->hi_key, tv_get_string(item));
4812  return FAIL;
4813  }
4814  if (buflist_findnr(opt->jo_io_buf[part]) == NULL)
4815  {
4816  semsg(_(e_nobufnr), (long)opt->jo_io_buf[part]);
4817  return FAIL;
4818  }
4819  }
4820  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_modifiable") == 0
4821  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_modifiable") == 0)
4822  {
4823  part = part_from_char(*hi->hi_key);
4824 
4825  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4826  break;
4827  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_MODIFIABLE << (part - PART_OUT);
4828  opt->jo_modifiable[part] = tv_get_number(item);
4829  }
4830  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_msg") == 0
4831  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_msg") == 0)
4832  {
4833  part = part_from_char(*hi->hi_key);
4834 
4835  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4836  break;
4837  opt->jo_set2 |= JO2_OUT_MSG << (part - PART_OUT);
4838  opt->jo_message[part] = tv_get_number(item);
4839  }
4840  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_top") == 0
4841  || STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "in_bot") == 0)
4842  {
4843  linenr_T *lp;
4844 
4845  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4846  break;
4847  if (hi->hi_key[3] == 't')
4848  {
4849  lp = &opt->jo_in_top;
4850  opt->jo_set |= JO_IN_TOP;
4851  }
4852  else
4853  {
4854  lp = &opt->jo_in_bot;
4855  opt->jo_set |= JO_IN_BOT;
4856  }
4857  *lp = tv_get_number(item);
4858  if (*lp < 0)
4859  {
4860  semsg(_(e_invargNval), hi->hi_key, tv_get_string(item));
4861  return FAIL;
4862  }
4863  }
4864  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "channel") == 0)
4865  {
4866  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_IO))
4867  break;
4868  opt->jo_set |= JO_CHANNEL;
4869  if (item->v_type != VAR_CHANNEL)
4870  {
4871  semsg(_(e_invargval), "channel");
4872  return FAIL;
4873  }
4874  opt->jo_channel = item->vval.v_channel;
4875  }
4876  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "callback") == 0)
4877  {
4878  if (!(supported & JO_CALLBACK))
4879  break;
4880  opt->jo_set |= JO_CALLBACK;
4881  opt->jo_callback = get_callback(item);
4882  if (opt->jo_callback.cb_name == NULL)
4883  {
4884  semsg(_(e_invargval), "callback");
4885  return FAIL;
4886  }
4887  }
4888  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_cb") == 0)
4889  {
4890  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_CALLBACK))
4891  break;
4892  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_CALLBACK;
4893  opt->jo_out_cb = get_callback(item);
4894  if (opt->jo_out_cb.cb_name == NULL)
4895  {
4896  semsg(_(e_invargval), "out_cb");
4897  return FAIL;
4898  }
4899  }
4900  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_cb") == 0)
4901  {
4902  if (!(supported & JO_ERR_CALLBACK))
4903  break;
4904  opt->jo_set |= JO_ERR_CALLBACK;
4905  opt->jo_err_cb = get_callback(item);
4906  if (opt->jo_err_cb.cb_name == NULL)
4907  {
4908  semsg(_(e_invargval), "err_cb");
4909  return FAIL;
4910  }
4911  }
4912  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "close_cb") == 0)
4913  {
4914  if (!(supported & JO_CLOSE_CALLBACK))
4915  break;
4916  opt->jo_set |= JO_CLOSE_CALLBACK;
4917  opt->jo_close_cb = get_callback(item);
4918  if (opt->jo_close_cb.cb_name == NULL)
4919  {
4920  semsg(_(e_invargval), "close_cb");
4921  return FAIL;
4922  }
4923  }

4947  return FAIL;

5085  opt->jo_term_kill = tv_get_string_chk(item);
5086  }
5087  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "tty_type") == 0)
5088  {
5089  char_u *p;
5090 
5091  if (!(supported2 & JO2_TTY_TYPE))
5092  break;
5093  opt->jo_set2 |= JO2_TTY_TYPE;
5094  p = tv_get_string_chk(item);
5095  if (p == NULL)

5100  // Allow empty string, "winpty", "conpty".

5108  }
5109 # if defined(FEAT_GUI) || defined(FEAT_TERMGUICOLORS)
5110  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "ansi_colors") == 0)
5111  {

5113  listitem_T *li;

5116  if (!(supported2 & JO2_ANSI_COLORS))

5119  if (item == NULL || item->v_type != VAR_LIST
5120  || item->vval.v_list == NULL)

5123  return FAIL;
5124  }

5126  li = item->vval.v_list->lv_first;
5127  for (; li != NULL && n < 16; li = li->li_next, n++)
5128  {
5129  char_u *color_name;
5130  guicolor_T guicolor;
5131 
5132  color_name = tv_get_string_chk(&li->li_tv);
5133  if (color_name == NULL)
5134  return FAIL;
5135 
5136  guicolor = GUI_GET_COLOR(color_name);
5137  if (guicolor == INVALCOLOR)
5138  return FAIL;
5139 
5140  rgb[n] = GUI_MCH_GET_RGB(guicolor);
5141  }
5142 
5143  if (n != 16 || li != NULL)
5144  {

5146  return FAIL;
5147  }
5148

5150  memcpy(opt->jo_ansi_colors, rgb, sizeof(rgb));
5151  }

5153  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "term_api") == 0)
5154  {

5156  break;

5159  opt->jo_term_api_buf);
5160  }
5161 #endif
5162  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "env") == 0)
5163  {

5165  break;
5166  if (item->v_type != VAR_DICT)
5167  {

5172  opt->jo_env = item->vval.v_dict;
5173  if (opt->jo_env != NULL)
5174  ++opt->jo_env->dv_refcount;

5177  {

5179  break;
5180  opt->jo_cwd = tv_get_string_buf_chk(item, opt->jo_cwd_buf);
5181  if (opt->jo_cwd == NULL || !mch_isdir(opt->jo_cwd)
5182 #ifndef MSWIN // Win32 directories don't have the concept of "executable"
5183  || mch_access((char *)opt->jo_cwd, X_OK) != 0
5184 #endif
5185  )

5188  return FAIL;

5190  opt->jo_set2 |= JO2_CWD;

5193  {
5194  if (!(supported & JO_WAITTIME))
5195  break;
5196  opt->jo_set |= JO_WAITTIME;
5197  opt->jo_waittime = tv_get_number(item);
5198  }
5199  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "timeout") == 0)
5200  {

5202  break;

5204  opt->jo_timeout = tv_get_number(item);
5205  }
5206  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "out_timeout") == 0)
5207  {
5208  if (!(supported & JO_OUT_TIMEOUT))
5209  break;
5210  opt->jo_set |= JO_OUT_TIMEOUT;
5211  opt->jo_out_timeout = tv_get_number(item);
5212  }
5213  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "err_timeout") == 0)
5214  {
5215  if (!(supported & JO_ERR_TIMEOUT))
5216  break;
5217  opt->jo_set |= JO_ERR_TIMEOUT;
5218  opt->jo_err_timeout = tv_get_number(item);
5219  }
5220  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "part") == 0)
5221  {
5222  if (!(supported & JO_PART))
5223  break;
5224  opt->jo_set |= JO_PART;
5225  val = tv_get_string(item);
5226  if (STRCMP(val, "err") == 0)
5227  opt->jo_part = PART_ERR;
5228  else if (STRCMP(val, "out") == 0)
5229  opt->jo_part = PART_OUT;
5230  else
5231  {
5232  semsg(_(e_invargNval), "part", val);
5233  return FAIL;
5234  }
5235  }
5236  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "id") == 0)
5237  {
5238  if (!(supported & JO_ID))
5239  break;
5240  opt->jo_set |= JO_ID;
5241  opt->jo_id = tv_get_number(item);
5242  }

5244  {
5245  if (!(supported & JO_STOPONEXIT))
5246  break;
5247  opt->jo_set |= JO_STOPONEXIT;
5248  opt->jo_stoponexit = tv_get_string_buf_chk(item,
5249  opt->jo_soe_buf);
5250  if (opt->jo_stoponexit == NULL)
5251  {
5252  semsg(_(e_invargval), "stoponexit");
5253  return FAIL;
5254  }
5255  }
5256  else if (STRCMP(hi->hi_key, "block_write") == 0)
5257  {
5258  if (!(supported & JO_BLOCK_WRITE))
5259  break;
5260  opt->jo_set |= JO_BLOCK_WRITE;
5261  opt->jo_block_write = tv_get_number(item);
5262  }
5263  else
5264  break;
5265  --todo;
5266  }
5267  if (todo > 0)
5268  {
5269  semsg(_(e_invarg2), hi->hi_key);
5270  return FAIL;
5271  }
5272 
5273  return OK;
5274 }
5275 
5276 static job_T *first_job = NULL;
5277 
5278  static void
5279 job_free_contents(job_T *job)
5280 {
5281  int i;
5282 
5283  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "Freeing job");
5284  if (job->jv_channel != NULL)
5285  {
5286  /* The link from the channel to the job doesn't count as a reference,
5287  * thus don't decrement the refcount of the job. The reference from
5288  * the job to the channel does count the reference, decrement it and
5289  * NULL the reference. We don't set ch_job_killed, unreferencing the
5290  * job doesn't mean it stops running. */
5291  job->jv_channel->ch_job = NULL;
5292  channel_unref(job->jv_channel);
5293  }
5294  mch_clear_job(job);
5295 
5296  vim_free(job->jv_tty_in);
5297  vim_free(job->jv_tty_out);
5298  vim_free(job->jv_stoponexit);
5299 #ifdef UNIX
5300  vim_free(job->jv_termsig);
5301 #endif
5302 #ifdef MSWIN
5303  vim_free(job->jv_tty_type);
5304 #endif
5305  free_callback(&job->jv_exit_cb);
5306  if (job->jv_argv != NULL)
5307  {
5308  for (i = 0; job->jv_argv[i] != NULL; i++)
5309  vim_free(job->jv_argv[i]);
5310  vim_free(job->jv_argv);
5311  }
5312 }
5313 
5314 /*
5315  * Remove "job" from the list of jobs.
5316  */
5317  static void
5318 job_unlink(job_T *job)
5319 {
5320  if (job->jv_next != NULL)
5321  job->jv_next->jv_prev = job->jv_prev;
5322  if (job->jv_prev == NULL)
5323  first_job = job->jv_next;
5324  else
5325  job->jv_prev->jv_next = job->jv_next;
5326 }
5327 
5328  static void
5329 job_free_job(job_T *job)
5330 {
5331  job_unlink(job);
5332  vim_free(job);
5333 }
5334 
5335  static void
5336 job_free(job_T *job)
5337 {
5338  if (!in_free_unref_items)
5339  {
5340  job_free_contents(job);
5341  job_free_job(job);
5342  }
5343 }
5344 
5345 static job_T *jobs_to_free = NULL;
5346 
5347 /*
5348  * Put "job" in a list to be freed later, when it's no longer referenced.
5349  */
5350  static void
5351 job_free_later(job_T *job)
5352 {
5353  job_unlink(job);
5354  job->jv_next = jobs_to_free;
5355  jobs_to_free = job;
5356 }
5357 
5358  static void
5359 free_jobs_to_free_later(void)
5360 {
5361  job_T *job;
5362 
5363  while (jobs_to_free != NULL)
5364  {
5365  job = jobs_to_free;
5366  jobs_to_free = job->jv_next;
5367  job_free_contents(job);
5368  vim_free(job);
5369  }
5370 }
5371 
5372 #if defined(EXITFREE) || defined(PROTO)
5373  void
5374 job_free_all(void)
5375 {
5376  while (first_job != NULL)
5377  job_free(first_job);
5378  free_jobs_to_free_later();
5379 
5380 # ifdef FEAT_TERMINAL
5381  free_unused_terminals();
5382 # endif
5383 }
5384 #endif
5385 
5386 /*
5387  * Return TRUE if we need to check if the process of "job" has ended.
5388  */
5389  static int
5390 job_need_end_check(job_T *job)
5391 {
5392  return job->jv_status == JOB_STARTED
5393  && (job->jv_stoponexit != NULL || job->jv_exit_cb.cb_name != NULL);
5394 }
5395 
5396 /*
5397  * Return TRUE if the channel of "job" is still useful.
5398  */
5399  static int
5400 job_channel_still_useful(job_T *job)
5401 {
5402  return job->jv_channel != NULL && channel_still_useful(job->jv_channel);
5403 }
5404 
5405 /*
5406  * Return TRUE if the channel of "job" is closeable.
5407  */
5408  static int
5409 job_channel_can_close(job_T *job)
5410 {
5411  return job->jv_channel != NULL && channel_can_close(job->jv_channel);
5412 }
5413 
5414 /*
5415  * Return TRUE if the job should not be freed yet. Do not free the job when
5416  * it has not ended yet and there is a "stoponexit" flag, an exit callback
5417  * or when the associated channel will do something with the job output.
5418  */
5419  static int
5420 job_still_useful(job_T *job)
5421 {
5422  return job_need_end_check(job) || job_channel_still_useful(job);
5423 }
5424 
5425 #if defined(GUI_MAY_FORK) || defined(GUI_MAY_SPAWN) || defined(PROTO)
5426 /*
5427  * Return TRUE when there is any running job that we care about.
5428  */
5429  int
5430 job_any_running()
5431 {
5432  job_T *job;
5433 
5434  for (job = first_job; job != NULL; job = job->jv_next)
5435  if (job_still_useful(job))
5436  {
5437  ch_log(NULL, "GUI not forking because a job is running");
5438  return TRUE;
5439  }
5440  return FALSE;
5441 }
5442 #endif
5443 
5444 #if !defined(USE_ARGV) || defined(PROTO)
5445 /*
5446  * Escape one argument for an external command.
5447  * Returns the escaped string in allocated memory. NULL when out of memory.
5448  */
5449  static char_u *
5450 win32_escape_arg(char_u *arg)
5451 {
5452  int slen, dlen;
5453  int escaping = 0;
5454  int i;
5455  char_u *s, *d;
5456  char_u *escaped_arg;
5457  int has_spaces = FALSE;
5458 
5459  /* First count the number of extra bytes required. */
5460  slen = (int)STRLEN(arg);
5461  dlen = slen;
5462  for (s = arg; *s != NUL; MB_PTR_ADV(s))
5463  {
5464  if (*s == '"' || *s == '\\')
5465  ++dlen;
5466  if (*s == ' ' || *s == '\t')
5467  has_spaces = TRUE;
5468  }
5469 
5470  if (has_spaces)
5471  dlen += 2;
5472 
5473  if (dlen == slen)
5474  return vim_strsave(arg);
5475 
5476  /* Allocate memory for the result and fill it. */
5477  escaped_arg = alloc(dlen + 1);
5478  if (escaped_arg == NULL)
5479  return NULL;
5480  memset(escaped_arg, 0, dlen+1);
5481 
5482  d = escaped_arg;
5483 
5484  if (has_spaces)
5485  *d++ = '"';
5486 
5487  for (s = arg; *s != NUL;)
5488  {
5489  switch (*s)
5490  {
5491  case '"':
5492  for (i = 0; i < escaping; i++)
5493  *d++ = '\\';
5494  escaping = 0;
5495  *d++ = '\\';
5496  *d++ = *s++;
5497  break;
5498  case '\\':
5499  escaping++;
5500  *d++ = *s++;
5501  break;
5502  default:
5503  escaping = 0;
5504  MB_COPY_CHAR(s, d);
5505  break;
5506  }
5507  }
5508 
5509  /* add terminating quote and finish with a NUL */
5510  if (has_spaces)
5511  {
5512  for (i = 0; i < escaping; i++)
5513  *d++ = '\\';
5514  *d++ = '"';
5515  }
5516  *d = NUL;
5517 
5518  return escaped_arg;
5519 }
5520 
5521 /*
5522  * Build a command line from a list, taking care of escaping.
5523  * The result is put in gap->ga_data.
5524  * Returns FAIL when out of memory.
5525  */
5526  int
5527 win32_build_cmd(list_T *l, garray_T *gap)
5528 {
5529  listitem_T *li;
5530  char_u *s;
5531 
5532  for (li = l->lv_first; li != NULL; li = li->li_next)
5533  {
5534  s = tv_get_string_chk(&li->li_tv);
5535  if (s == NULL)
5536  return FAIL;
5537  s = win32_escape_arg(s);
5538  if (s == NULL)
5539  return FAIL;
5540  ga_concat(gap, s);
5541  vim_free(s);
5542  if (li->li_next != NULL)
5543  ga_append(gap, ' ');
5544  }
5545  return OK;
5546 }
5547 #endif
5548 
5549 /*
5550  * NOTE: Must call job_cleanup() only once right after the status of "job"
5551  * changed to JOB_ENDED (i.e. after job_status() returned "dead" first or
5552  * mch_detect_ended_job() returned non-NULL).
5553  * If the job is no longer used it will be removed from the list of jobs, and
5554  * deleted a bit later.
5555  */
5556  void
5557 job_cleanup(job_T *job)
5558 {
5559  if (job->jv_status != JOB_ENDED)
5560  return;
5561 
5562  /* Ready to cleanup the job. */
5563  job->jv_status = JOB_FINISHED;
5564 
5565  /* When only channel-in is kept open, close explicitly. */
5566  if (job->jv_channel != NULL)
5567  ch_close_part(job->jv_channel, PART_IN);
5568 
5569  if (job->jv_exit_cb.cb_name != NULL)
5570  {
5571  typval_T argv[3];
5572  typval_T rettv;
5573 
5574  /* Invoke the exit callback. Make sure the refcount is > 0. */
5575  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "Invoking exit callback %s",
5576  job->jv_exit_cb.cb_name);
5577  ++job->jv_refcount;
5578  argv[0].v_type = VAR_JOB;
5579  argv[0].vval.v_job = job;
5580  argv[1].v_type = VAR_NUMBER;
5581  argv[1].vval.v_number = job->jv_exitval;
5582  call_callback(&job->jv_exit_cb, -1, &rettv, 2, argv);
5583  clear_tv(&rettv);
5584  --job->jv_refcount;
5585  channel_need_redraw = TRUE;
5586  }
5587 
5588  if (job->jv_channel != NULL && job->jv_channel->ch_anonymous_pipe)
5589  job->jv_channel->ch_killing = TRUE;
5590 
5591  // Do not free the job in case the close callback of the associated channel
5592  // isn't invoked yet and may get information by job_info().
5593  if (job->jv_refcount == 0 && !job_channel_still_useful(job))
5594  // The job was already unreferenced and the associated channel was
5595  // detached, now that it ended it can be freed. However, a caller might
5596  // still use it, thus free it a bit later.
5597  job_free_later(job);
5598 }
5599 
5600 /*
5601  * Mark references in jobs that are still useful.
5602  */
5603  int
5604 set_ref_in_job(int copyID)
5605 {
5606  int abort = FALSE;
5607  job_T *job;
5608  typval_T tv;
5609 
5610  for (job = first_job; !abort && job != NULL; job = job->jv_next)
5611  if (job_still_useful(job))
5612  {
5613  tv.v_type = VAR_JOB;
5614  tv.vval.v_job = job;
5615  abort = abort || set_ref_in_item(&tv, copyID, NULL, NULL);
5616  }
5617  return abort;
5618 }
5619 
5620 /*
5621  * Dereference "job". Note that after this "job" may have been freed.
5622  */
5623  void
5624 job_unref(job_T *job)
5625 {
5626  if (job != NULL && --job->jv_refcount <= 0)
5627  {
5628  /* Do not free the job if there is a channel where the close callback
5629  * may get the job info. */
5630  if (!job_channel_still_useful(job))
5631  {
5632  /* Do not free the job when it has not ended yet and there is a
5633  * "stoponexit" flag or an exit callback. */
5634  if (!job_need_end_check(job))
5635  {
5636  job_free(job);
5637  }
5638  else if (job->jv_channel != NULL)
5639  {
5640  /* Do remove the link to the channel, otherwise it hangs
5641  * around until Vim exits. See job_free() for refcount. */
5642  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "detaching channel from job");
5643  job->jv_channel->ch_job = NULL;
5644  channel_unref(job->jv_channel);
5645  job->jv_channel = NULL;
5646  }
5647  }
5648  }
5649 }
5650 
5651  int
5652 free_unused_jobs_contents(int copyID, int mask)
5653 {
5654  int did_free = FALSE;
5655  job_T *job;
5656 
5657  for (job = first_job; job != NULL; job = job->jv_next)
5658  if ((job->jv_copyID & mask) != (copyID & mask)
5659  && !job_still_useful(job))
5660  {
5661  /* Free the channel and ordinary items it contains, but don't
5662  * recurse into Lists, Dictionaries etc. */
5663  job_free_contents(job);
5664  did_free = TRUE;
5665  }
5666  return did_free;
5667 }
5668 
5669  void
5670 free_unused_jobs(int copyID, int mask)
5671 {
5672  job_T *job;
5673  job_T *job_next;
5674 
5675  for (job = first_job; job != NULL; job = job_next)
5676  {
5677  job_next = job->jv_next;
5678  if ((job->jv_copyID & mask) != (copyID & mask)
5679  && !job_still_useful(job))
5680  {
5681  /* Free the job struct itself. */
5682  job_free_job(job);
5683  }
5684  }
5685 }
5686 
5687 /*
5688  * Allocate a job. Sets the refcount to one and sets options default.
5689  */
5690  job_T *
5691 job_alloc(void)
5692 {
5693  job_T *job;
5694 
5695  job = ALLOC_CLEAR_ONE(job_T);
5696  if (job != NULL)
5697  {
5698  job->jv_refcount = 1;
5699  job->jv_stoponexit = vim_strsave((char_u *)"term");
5700 
5701  if (first_job != NULL)
5702  {
5703  first_job->jv_prev = job;
5704  job->jv_next = first_job;
5705  }
5706  first_job = job;
5707  }
5708  return job;
5709 }
5710 
5711  void
5712 job_set_options(job_T *job, jobopt_T *opt)
5713 {
5714  if (opt->jo_set & JO_STOPONEXIT)
5715  {
5716  vim_free(job->jv_stoponexit);
5717  if (opt->jo_stoponexit == NULL || *opt->jo_stoponexit == NUL)
5718  job->jv_stoponexit = NULL;
5719  else
5720  job->jv_stoponexit = vim_strsave(opt->jo_stoponexit);
5721  }
5722  if (opt->jo_set & JO_EXIT_CB)
5723  {
5724  free_callback(&job->jv_exit_cb);
5725  if (opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_name == NULL || *opt->jo_exit_cb.cb_name == NUL)
5726  {
5727  job->jv_exit_cb.cb_name = NULL;
5728  job->jv_exit_cb.cb_partial = NULL;
5729  }
5730  else
5731  copy_callback(&job->jv_exit_cb, &opt->jo_exit_cb);
5732  }
5733 }
5734 
5735 /*
5736  * Called when Vim is exiting: kill all jobs that have the "stoponexit" flag.
5737  */
5738  void
5739 job_stop_on_exit(void)
5740 {
5741  job_T *job;
5742 
5743  for (job = first_job; job != NULL; job = job->jv_next)
5744  if (job->jv_status == JOB_STARTED && job->jv_stoponexit != NULL)
5745  mch_signal_job(job, job->jv_stoponexit);
5746 }
5747 
5748 /*
5749  * Return TRUE when there is any job that has an exit callback and might exit,
5750  * which means job_check_ended() should be called more often.
5751  */
5752  int
5753 has_pending_job(void)
5754 {
5755  job_T *job;
5756 
5757  for (job = first_job; job != NULL; job = job->jv_next)
5758  /* Only should check if the channel has been closed, if the channel is
5759  * open the job won't exit. */
5760  if ((job->jv_status == JOB_STARTED && !job_channel_still_useful(job))
5761  || (job->jv_status == JOB_FINISHED
5762  && job_channel_can_close(job)))
5763  return TRUE;
5764  return FALSE;
5765 }
5766 
5767 #define MAX_CHECK_ENDED 8
5768 
5769 /*
5770  * Called once in a while: check if any jobs that seem useful have ended.
5771  * Returns TRUE if a job did end.
5772  */
5773  int
5774 job_check_ended(void)
5775 {
5776  int i;
5777  int did_end = FALSE;
5778 
5779  // be quick if there are no jobs to check
5780  if (first_job == NULL)
5781  return did_end;
5782 
5783  for (i = 0; i < MAX_CHECK_ENDED; ++i)
5784  {
5785  // NOTE: mch_detect_ended_job() must only return a job of which the
5786  // status was just set to JOB_ENDED.
5787  job_T *job = mch_detect_ended_job(first_job);
5788 
5789  if (job == NULL)
5790  break;
5791  did_end = TRUE;
5792  job_cleanup(job); // may add "job" to jobs_to_free
5793  }
5794 
5795  // Actually free jobs that were cleaned up.
5796  free_jobs_to_free_later();
5797 
5798  if (channel_need_redraw)
5799  {
5800  channel_need_redraw = FALSE;
5801  redraw_after_callback(TRUE);
5802  }
5803  return did_end;
5804 }
5805 
5806 /*
5807  * Create a job and return it. Implements job_start().
5808  * "argv_arg" is only for Unix.
5809  * When "argv_arg" is NULL then "argvars" is used.
5810  * The returned job has a refcount of one.
5811  * Returns NULL when out of memory.
5812  */
5813  job_T *
5814 job_start(
5815  typval_T *argvars,
5816  char **argv_arg UNUSED,
5817  jobopt_T *opt_arg,
5818  int is_terminal UNUSED)
5819 {
5820  job_T *job;
5821  char_u *cmd = NULL;
5822  char **argv = NULL;
5823  int argc = 0;
5824 #if defined(UNIX)
5825 # define USE_ARGV
5826  int i;
5827 #else
5828  garray_T ga;
5829 #endif
5830  jobopt_T opt;
5831  ch_part_T part;
5832 
5833  job = job_alloc();
5834  if (job == NULL)
5835  return NULL;
5836 
5837  job->jv_status = JOB_FAILED;
5838 #ifndef USE_ARGV
5839  ga_init2(&ga, (int)sizeof(char*), 20);
5840 #endif
5841 
5842  if (opt_arg != NULL)
5843  opt = *opt_arg;
5844  else
5845  {
5846  /* Default mode is NL. */
5847  clear_job_options(&opt);
5848  opt.jo_mode = MODE_NL;
5849  if (get_job_options(&argvars[1], &opt,
5850  JO_MODE_ALL + JO_CB_ALL + JO_TIMEOUT_ALL + JO_STOPONEXIT
5851  + JO_EXIT_CB + JO_OUT_IO + JO_BLOCK_WRITE,
5852  JO2_ENV + JO2_CWD) == FAIL)
5853  goto theend;
5854  }
5855 
5856  /* Check that when io is "file" that there is a file name. */
5857  for (part = PART_OUT; part < PART_COUNT; ++part)
5858  if ((opt.jo_set & (JO_OUT_IO << (part - PART_OUT)))
5859  && opt.jo_io[part] == JIO_FILE
5860  && (!(opt.jo_set & (JO_OUT_NAME << (part - PART_OUT)))
5861  || *opt.jo_io_name[part] == NUL))
5862  {
5863  emsg(_("E920: _io file requires _name to be set"));
5864  goto theend;
5865  }
5866 
5867  if ((opt.jo_set & JO_IN_IO) && opt.jo_io[PART_IN] == JIO_BUFFER)
5868  {
5869  buf_T *buf = NULL;
5870 
5871  /* check that we can find the buffer before starting the job */
5872  if (opt.jo_set & JO_IN_BUF)
5873  {
5874  buf = buflist_findnr(opt.jo_io_buf[PART_IN]);
5875  if (buf == NULL)
5876  semsg(_(e_nobufnr), (long)opt.jo_io_buf[PART_IN]);
5877  }
5878  else if (!(opt.jo_set & JO_IN_NAME))
5879  {
5880  emsg(_("E915: in_io buffer requires in_buf or in_name to be set"));
5881  }
5882  else
5883  buf = buflist_find_by_name(opt.jo_io_name[PART_IN], FALSE);
5884  if (buf == NULL)
5885  goto theend;
5886  if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL)
5887  {
5888  char_u numbuf[NUMBUFLEN];
5889  char_u *s;
5890 
5891  if (opt.jo_set & JO_IN_BUF)
5892  {
5893  sprintf((char *)numbuf, "%d", opt.jo_io_buf[PART_IN]);
5894  s = numbuf;
5895  }
5896  else
5897  s = opt.jo_io_name[PART_IN];
5898  semsg(_("E918: buffer must be loaded: %s"), s);
5899  goto theend;
5900  }
5901  job->jv_in_buf = buf;
5902  }
5903 
5904  job_set_options(job, &opt);
5905 
5906 #ifdef USE_ARGV
5907  if (argv_arg != NULL)
5908  {
5909  /* Make a copy of argv_arg for job->jv_argv. */
5910  for (i = 0; argv_arg[i] != NULL; i++)
5911  argc++;
5912  argv = ALLOC_MULT(char *, argc + 1);
5913  if (argv == NULL)
5914  goto theend;
5915  for (i = 0; i < argc; i++)
5916  argv[i] = (char *)vim_strsave((char_u *)argv_arg[i]);
5917  argv[argc] = NULL;
5918  }
5919  else
5920 #endif
5921  if (argvars[0].v_type == VAR_STRING)
5922  {
5923  /* Command is a string. */
5924  cmd = argvars[0].vval.v_string;
5925  if (cmd == NULL || *cmd == NUL)
5926  {
5927  emsg(_(e_invarg));
5928  goto theend;
5929  }
5930 
5931  if (build_argv_from_string(cmd, &argv, &argc) == FAIL)
5932  goto theend;
5933  }
5934  else if (argvars[0].v_type != VAR_LIST
5935  || argvars[0].vval.v_list == NULL
5936  || argvars[0].vval.v_list->lv_len < 1)
5937  {
5938  emsg(_(e_invarg));
5939  goto theend;
5940  }
5941  else
5942  {
5943  list_T *l = argvars[0].vval.v_list;
5944 
5945  if (build_argv_from_list(l, &argv, &argc) == FAIL)
5946  goto theend;
5947 #ifndef USE_ARGV
5948  if (win32_build_cmd(l, &ga) == FAIL)
5949  goto theend;
5950  cmd = ga.ga_data;
5951 #endif
5952  }
5953 
5954  /* Save the command used to start the job. */
5955  job->jv_argv = argv;
5956 
5957 #ifdef USE_ARGV
5958  if (ch_log_active())
5959  {
5960  garray_T ga;
5961 
5962  ga_init2(&ga, (int)sizeof(char), 200);
5963  for (i = 0; i < argc; ++i)
5964  {
5965  if (i > 0)
5966  ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)" ");
5967  ga_concat(&ga, (char_u *)argv[i]);
5968  }
5969  ga_append(&ga, NUL);
5970  ch_log(NULL, "Starting job: %s", (char *)ga.ga_data);
5971  ga_clear(&ga);
5972  }
5973  mch_job_start(argv, job, &opt, is_terminal);
5974 #else
5975  ch_log(NULL, "Starting job: %s", (char *)cmd);
5976  mch_job_start((char *)cmd, job, &opt);
5977 #endif
5978 
5979  /* If the channel is reading from a buffer, write lines now. */
5980  if (job->jv_channel != NULL)
5981  channel_write_in(job->jv_channel);
5982 
5983 theend:
5984 #ifndef USE_ARGV
5985  vim_free(ga.ga_data);
5986 #endif
5987  if (argv != job->jv_argv)
5988  vim_free(argv);
5989  free_job_options(&opt);
5990  return job;
5991 }
5992 
5993 /*
5994  * Get the status of "job" and invoke the exit callback when needed.
5995  * The returned string is not allocated.
5996  */
5997  char *
5998 job_status(job_T *job)
5999 {
6000  char *result;
6001 
6002  if (job->jv_status >= JOB_ENDED)
6003  /* No need to check, dead is dead. */
6004  result = "dead";
6005  else if (job->jv_status == JOB_FAILED)
6006  result = "fail";
6007  else
6008  {
6009  result = mch_job_status(job);
6010  if (job->jv_status == JOB_ENDED)
6011  job_cleanup(job);
6012  }
6013  return result;
6014 }
6015 
6016 /*
6017  * Send a signal to "job". Implements job_stop().
6018  * When "type" is not NULL use this for the type.
6019  * Otherwise use argvars[1] for the type.
6020  */
6021  int
6022 job_stop(job_T *job, typval_T *argvars, char *type)
6023 {
6024  char_u *arg;
6025 
6026  if (type != NULL)
6027  arg = (char_u *)type;
6028  else if (argvars[1].v_type == VAR_UNKNOWN)
6029  arg = (char_u *)"";
6030  else
6031  {
6032  arg = tv_get_string_chk(&argvars[1]);
6033  if (arg == NULL)
6034  {
6035  emsg(_(e_invarg));
6036  return 0;
6037  }
6038  }
6039  if (job->jv_status == JOB_FAILED)
6040  {
6041  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "Job failed to start, job_stop() skipped");
6042  return 0;
6043  }
6044  if (job->jv_status == JOB_ENDED)
6045  {
6046  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "Job has already ended, job_stop() skipped");
6047  return 0;
6048  }
6049  ch_log(job->jv_channel, "Stopping job with '%s'", (char *)arg);
6050  if (mch_signal_job(job, arg) == FAIL)
6051  return 0;
6052 
6053  /* Assume that only "kill" will kill the job. */
6054  if (job->jv_channel != NULL && STRCMP(arg, "kill") == 0)
6055  job->jv_channel->ch_job_killed = TRUE;
6056 
6057  /* We don't try freeing the job, obviously the caller still has a
6058  * reference to it. */
6059  return 1;
6060 }
6061 
6062  void
6063 invoke_prompt_callback(void)
6064 {
6065  typval_T rettv;
6066  typval_T argv[2];
6067  char_u *text;
6068  char_u *prompt;
6069  linenr_T lnum = curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count;
6070 
6071  // Add a new line for the prompt before invoking the callback, so that
6072  // text can always be inserted above the last line.
6073  ml_append(lnum, (char_u *)"", 0, FALSE);
6074  curwin->w_cursor.lnum = lnum + 1;
6075  curwin->w_cursor.col = 0;
6076 
6077  if (curbuf->b_prompt_callback.cb_name == NULL
6078  || *curbuf->b_prompt_callback.cb_name == NUL)
6079  return;
6080  text = ml_get(lnum);
6081  prompt = prompt_text();
6082  if (STRLEN(text) >= STRLEN(prompt))
6083  text += STRLEN(prompt);
6084  argv[0].v_type = VAR_STRING;
6085  argv[0].vval.v_string = vim_strsave(text);
6086  argv[1].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
6087 
6088  call_callback(&curbuf->b_prompt_callback, -1, &rettv, 1, argv);
6089  clear_tv(&argv[0]);
6090  clear_tv(&rettv);
6091 }
6092 
6093 /*
6094  * Return TRUE when the interrupt callback was invoked.
6095  */
6096  int
6097 invoke_prompt_interrupt(void)
6098 {
6099  typval_T rettv;
6100  typval_T argv[1];
6101 
6102  if (curbuf->b_prompt_interrupt.cb_name == NULL
6103  || *curbuf->b_prompt_interrupt.cb_name == NUL)
6104  return FALSE;
6105  argv[0].v_type = VAR_UNKNOWN;
6106 
6107  got_int = FALSE; // don't skip executing commands
6108  call_callback(&curbuf->b_prompt_interrupt, -1, &rettv, 0, argv);
6109  clear_tv(&rettv);
6110  return TRUE;
6111 }
